g

ga 1.1

adj. who goes; goes after; going; gone; having gone; being [√gam + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from gacchati
Meaning who goes; goes after; going; gone; having gone; being
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym gāmī
Sanskrit ga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ,
cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso,
t'ādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.

TH 25 nandiyattheragāthā

evaṃ mano chassu yadā subhāvito,
phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,
te rāgadose abhibhuyya bhikkhavo,
bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
ga 2.1

ind. 3rd item in a numerical list; lit. letter g ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning 3rd item in a numerical list; lit. letter g
Sanskrit ga

Example

(ga) katamo eko dhammo pariññeyyo? phasso s'āsavo upādāniyo. ayaṃ eko dhammo pariññeyyo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
gagana

nt. sky ✗
gaganagāmī

adj. flying through the sky ✗
gaganatala

nt. sky; heaven ✗
gagga

masc. name of the family of Aṅgulimāla ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the family of Aṅgulimāla
gaggarā

fem. name of a lotus pond near Campā; lit. gurgling [gaggara + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, onom, from gaggara
Meaning name of a lotus pond near Campā; lit. gurgling
Construction gaggara + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (MNa) gaggarā'ti laddhavohārā pokkharaṇī atthi. tassā tīre samantato nīl'ādipañcavaṇṇakusumapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ mahantaṃ campakavanaṃ. tasmiṃ bhagavā kusumagandhasugandhe campakavane viharati. taṃ sandhāya gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit gargara, gargā (bsk)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

DN 34.1 dasuttarasuttaṃ
gaggarāyati

pr. bellows, roars [gaggara] ✗
gaggarāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 8.11 (SN8.11) ✗
gaggarī

fem. bellows [gaggara + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from gaggara
Meaning bellows
Construction gaggara + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Synonym bhastā
Commentary (MNa) kammāragaggariyā'ti kammārassa gaggaranāḷiyā.
Sanskrit gargarī (churn)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma kammāragaggariyā dhamamānāya adhimatto saddo hoti, evam'eva kho me, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇasotehi vātānaṃ nikkhamantānaṃ adhimatto saddo hoti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
gaggalaka

masc. eddy; whirlpool; maelstrom [gaggara + ka] ~

Grammar masc, onom, from gaggara
Meaning eddy; whirlpool; maelstrom
Construction gaggara > gaggala + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym āvaṭṭa
Sanskrit gargara, gargā (bsk)
gagghati

fut. (+acc) will go; will walk; will wander around [√gam + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will go; will walk; will wander around
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a + issa > gaggha (fut, irreg)
Construction gaggha + ti
Commentary (ANa) gagghasī'ti gamissasi.
Sanskrit gamiṣyati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

yena yen'eva gagghasi phāsuṃ'y'eva gagghasi, yattha yattha ṭhassasi phāsuṃ'y'eva ṭhassasi, yattha yattha nisīdissasi phāsuṃ'y'eva nisīdissasi, yattha yattha seyyaṃ kappessasi phāsuṃ'y'eva seyyaṃ kappessasī'ti.

AN 8.63 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
gaṅgamālajātaka

nt. Jātaka 421 (JA 421) ✗
gaṅgā 1

fem. name of a river; one of the five great rivers of ancient India ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a river; one of the five great rivers of ancient India
Sanskrit gaṅgā

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalakaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu sā gaṅgā nadī amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyā'ti?

gaṅgāsama

adj. like the Ganges river [gaṅgā + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like the Ganges river
Construction gaṅgā + sama
Compound kammadhāraya (gaṅgā + sama)
Sanskrit gaṅgā + sama

Example

tañ'ca puggalaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharissāma, tadārammaṇañ'ca sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ gaṅgāsamena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharissāmā'ti.

gaccha 1

imp. (+acc) go!; begone! [√gam + a + a] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of gacchatu, trans (+acc)
Meaning go!; begone!
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + a
Sanskrit gaccha
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

hivibhatti lopam'āpajjate vā. gaccha, gacchāhi, gama, gamāhi, gamaya, gamayāhi. hī'ti kim'atthaṃ? gacchati, gamayati.

gacchati 1

pr. (+acc) goes; walks; moves; wanders around [√gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes; walks; moves; wanders around
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + ti
Synonym jaṅgamati
Sanskrit gacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gacchanto vā gacchāmī'ti pajānāti ṭhito vā ṭhito'mhī'ti pajānāti nisinno vā nisinno'mhī'ti pajānāti sayāno vā sayāno'mhī'ti pajānāti

DN 22.3 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yassa loke sakaṃ n'atthi,
asatā ca na socati,
dhammesu ca na gacchati,
sa ve santo'ti vuccatī'ti.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10
gacchati 2

pr. (+acc) becomes; lit. goes [√gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning becomes; lit. goes
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + ti
Sanskrit gacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

tassa imissā ca asappāyakiriyāya, asuci visadoso apanīto saupādiseso tadubhayena vaṇo puthuttaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
gacchanta

prp. (+acc) going; walking; travelling [√gam + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going; walking; travelling
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym gacchamāna, caranta, yāyanta
Sanskrit gacchat, gamat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

addasāma kho mayaṃ, bho, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ gacchantaṃ, addasāma ṭhitaṃ, addasāma antaragharaṃ pavisantaṃ, addasāma antaraghare nisinnaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

gacchanto kho pana ujumaggen'eva gacchati, tatr'āyaṃ ujumaggo, seyyath'idaṃ, sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
gacchantara

adj. within a bush [gaccha + antara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning within a bush
Construction gaccha + antara
gacchamāna

prp. (+acc) going; walking [√gam + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going; walking
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym gacchanta
Sanskrit gacchamāna
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me cittaṃ bahulaṃ gacchamānaṃ gaccheyya paccuppannesu vā appaṃ vā anāgatesu.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

gamu'icc'etassa dhātussa anto makāro ccho hoti vā sabbāsu paccayavibhattīsu. gacchamāno, gacchanto. gacchati, gameti. gacchatu, gametu. gaccheyya. gameyya. agacchā, agamā. agacchī, agamī. gacchissati, gamissati. agacchissā, agamissā. gamisse'ti kim'atthaṃ? icchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 476
gacchaṃ

aor. (+acc) I myself went [√gam + a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar aor, reflx 1st sg of gacchi, trans (+acc)
Meaning I myself went
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + aṃ
Variant agamaṃ
Notes also see gacchanta
Sanskrit agacche
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

eso hi bhagavā buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ pati,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
dhammaṃ deseti pāṇinaṃ,
tass'āhaṃ santikaṃ gacchaṃ,
so me satthā bhavissati.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
gacchāvuso

sandhi. begone friend!; go away brother! [gaccha + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + masc
Meaning begone friend!; go away brother!
Construction gaccha + āvuso
Sanskrit gaccha + āyusmanto

Example

gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 42 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ
gacchi

aor. went, moved, walked [√gam] ✗
gaccheyya

opt. (+acc) could go; would move; would walk [√gam + a + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning could go; would move; would walk
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + eyya
Commentary (MNa) yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti kiṃ me iminā sīghagamanena, saṇikaṃ gacchissāmī'ti cintesi.
Sanskrit gacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sīghaṃ gaccheyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ sīghaṃ gacchāmi? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti. so saṇikaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
gaja

masc. elephant [√gaj + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning elephant
Root Family √gaj
Root √gaj×1 a (roar, make sound)
Construction √gaj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym hatthi, hatthī, kuñjara, mātaṅga
Sanskrit gaja
Sanskrit Root √gaj 1 (roar)

Example

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
vīriyena taṃ mayha vas'ānayissaṃ,
gajaṃ'va mattaṃ kusal'aṅkusaggaho.

gajjati

pr. howls; roars; thunders [√gajj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning howls; roars; thunders
Root Family √gajj
Root √gajj･1 a (roar, thunder)
Base √gajj + a > gajja
Construction gajja + ti
Synonym nadati
Sanskrit garjati

Example

tumhe kapilavatthuvāsike gahetvā gajjatha, ye soṇasiṅgāl'ādayo viya attano bhaginīhi saddhiṃ saṃvasiṃsu

DNa 2.7.1 mahāsamaya sutta vaṇṇanā
gajjanā

fem. roaring [√gajj] ✗
gajjanta

prp. roaring, thundering [√gajj] ✗
gajjamāna

prp. thundering; roaring [√gajj + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of gajjati, intrans
Meaning thundering; roaring
Root Family √gajj
Root √gajj･1 a (roar, thunder)
Base √gajj + a > gajja
Construction gajja + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym abhigajjanta
Sanskrit garjamāna
Sanskrit Root √garj 1 (roar)

Example

yathā balākayonimhi,
na vijjati pumo sadā,
meghesu gajjamānesu,
gabbhaṃ gaṇhanti tā sadā.

APA 8 upāli therāpadānaṃ
gajjayitvā

abs. having roared [√gajj] ✗
gajji

aor. roared, thundered [√gajj] ✗
gajjita

pp. roar, thunder [√gajj] ✗
gajjitar

masc. who roars or thunders [√gajj] ✗
gajjitvā

abs. having roared, having thundered [√gajj] ✗
gaṇa 1

masc. group; crowd [√gaṇ + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gaṇeti
Meaning group; crowd
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym saṅgha
Sanskrit gaṇa
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Examples

mah'odadhiṃ aparimitaṃ mahāsaraṃ,
bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,
najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

SN 55.41 paṭhamaabhisandasuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññen'eva tāni caturāsīti pabbajitasahassāni agamaṃsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.

DN 14.10 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
gaṇa 2

masc. swarm; mass; horde; cluster [√gaṇ + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gaṇeti
Meaning swarm; mass; horde; cluster
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym saṅghāta, saṇḍa, saṃgha
Sanskrit gaṇa
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Example

sabbapaṭhamaṃ tāva kiñci'd'eva karuṇāyitabbarūpaṃ ... hatthapādehi paggharantakimigaṇaṃ aṭṭassaraṃ karontaṃ disvā, kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ satto āpanno, app'eva nāma imamhā dukkhā mucceyyā'ti karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
gaṇa 3

masc. sect; religion; religious order [√gaṇ + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gaṇeti
Meaning sect; religion; religious order
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit gaṇa
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Example

pakudhako kātiyāno nigaṇṭho,
ye c'āp'ime makkhalipūraṇāse,
gaṇassa satthāro sāmaññappattā,
na hi nūna te sappurisehi dūre'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
gaṇa 4

masc. (gram) set; group; collection [√gaṇ + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gaṇeti
Meaning (gram) set; group; collection
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym nikāya, vagga
Sanskrit gaṇa
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Examples

bhū'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato apaccayo hoti kattari. bhavati, paṭhati, pacati, jayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 445

bhū'icc'evam'ādayo ye saddagaṇā, te dhātusaññā honti. bhavati, bhavanti, carati, caranti, pacati, pacanti, cintayati, cintayanti, hoti, honti, gacchati, gacchanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 457
gaṇa 5

masc. (gram) conjugation [√gaṇ] ✗
gaṇa 6

nt. group; collection [√gaṇ] ✗
gaṇaka

masc. accountant; arithmetician; mathematician [√gaṇ + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from gaṇeti
Meaning accountant; arithmetician; mathematician
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + aka

Example

gaṇakī

fem. courtesan; high class prostitute; (comm) wife of an accountant [√gaṇ + a + kī] ~

Grammar fem, from gaṇa
Meaning courtesan; high class prostitute; (comm) wife of an accountant
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a + kī
gaṇa + kī
Derivative taddhita (kī)
Synonym gaṇikā
Commentary (VINa) purāṇagaṇakiyā'ti ekassa gaṇakassa bhariyāya, sā tasmiṃ jīvamāne gaṇakī'ti paññāyittha, mate pana purāṇagaṇakī'ti saṅkhaṃ gatā.
Notes thus gaṇaka + ī
Sanskrit gaṇakī
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

gaṇato

masc. from a group; from a crowd [√gaṇ + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of gaṇa
Meaning from a group; from a crowd
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a + to
gaṇa + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (VINa) gaṇato vā'ti idaṃ suttantikagaṇassa dema, idaṃ ābhidhammikagaṇassā'ti evaṃ gaṇassa denti. tato attano pattabhāgavasena gaṇato vā uppajjeyya.
Sanskrit gaṇāt
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Examples

uppajjeyyā'ti uppajjeyya saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

satiyā paccāsāyā'ti paccāsā hoti saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
gaṇana 2

Meaning number (of); lit. counting

Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)

Synonym gaṇanā, saṅkhyā
Sanskrit gaṇana
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Example

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning counting-craft; (comm) craft of uninteruupetd enumeration
Construction gaṇanā + sippa

Variant gaṇanasippa
Commentary (UDa) gaṇanasippan'ti acchiddakagaṇanasippaṃ.
Sanskrit gaṇanā + śilpa

Example

ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, muddāsippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti. ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, gaṇanāsippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti. ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, saṅkhānasippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti.

gaṇamanusāsati

pr. instructs a group; teaches a crowd [gaṇaṃ + anusāsati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning instructs a group; teaches a crowd
Construction gaṇaṃ + anusāsati
Compound comp verb (gaṇaṃ + anusāsati)
Commentary (MNa) gaṇam'anusāsantī'ti gaṇabandhanena baddhā gaṇ'ārāmā gaṇabahulikā hutvā gaṇaṃ pariharanti. evarūpā'pi ekacce atthi. tesaṃ paṭipakkhabhūtā gaṇato nissaṭā visaṃsaṭṭhā vippamuttavihārino'pi atthi.
Sanskrit gaṇam + anuśāsanti

Example

tathā hi pana ayam'āyasmā saṅghe vā viharanto eko vā viharanto, ye ca tattha sugatā ye ca tattha duggatā, ye ca tattha gaṇam'anusāsanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisesu saṃdissanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisena anupalittā, n'āyam'āyasmā taṃ tena avajānāti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
gaṇamanusāsitumarahati

pr. is able to teach a group; is qualified to teach a group; lit. worthy of teaching a group [gaṇaṃ + anusāsituṃ + arahati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning is able to teach a group; is qualified to teach a group; lit. worthy of teaching a group
Construction gaṇaṃ + anusāsituṃ + arahati
Sanskrit gaṇa + anuśās + arhati

Example

tatra idaṃ nissāya idaṃ pajahatha, tayo satipaṭṭhānā yadariyo sevati yadariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yogg'ācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti, ayam'uddeso saḷ'āyatanavibhaṅgassa.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
gaṇayanta

prp. (+acc) counting; calculating [√gaṇ + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gaṇayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning counting; calculating
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *aya (calculate, group)
Base √gaṇ + aya > gaṇaya
Construction gaṇaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit gaṇayat
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

Example

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho ajito kesakambalo saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

Example

nt. difficult and obscure passage ✗

nt. obscure word, glossary ✗
gaṇḍa 1

masc. boil; abscess; lit. swelling ✓

Meaning boil; abscess; lit. swelling

Examples

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ
gaṇḍa 2

masc. swelling; bulge; bump; protuberance ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning swelling; bulge; bump; protuberance
Sanskrit gaṇḍa

Example

na avagaṇḍakārakaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā gaṇḍaṃ katvā bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
gaṇḍa 3

masc. cheek [gaṇḍa] ✗
gaṇḍaka

masc. rhinoceros [gaṇḍa] ✗
gaṇḍajāta

nt. kinds of perfumes ✗
gaṇḍato

ind. as a boil; as an abscess [gaṇḍa + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of gaṇḍa
Meaning as a boil; as an abscess
Construction gaṇḍa + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (MNa) antodos'aṭṭhena gaṇḍato
Sanskrit gaṇḍāt

Example

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ
gaṇḍabhūta

adj. like a boil; like an abscess [gaṇḍa + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a boil; like an abscess
Construction gaṇḍa + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (gaṇḍa + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit gaṇḍa + bhūta

Example

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
gaṇḍamūla

nt. origin of the problem; (comm) source of suffering; lit. root of the boil [gaṇḍa + mūla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning origin of the problem; (comm) source of suffering; lit. root of the boil
Construction gaṇḍa + mūla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gaṇḍassa + mūla)
Commentary (SNa) apalikhataṃ gaṇḍamūlan'ti apalikhataṃ dukkhamūlaṃ.
Sanskrit gaṇḍa + mūla

Example

taṃ kho pan'etaṃ, bhikkhave, udako rāmaputto avedagū'y'eva samāno vedagū'smī'ti bhāsati, asabbajī'y'eva samāno sabbajī'smī'ti bhāsati, apalikhataṃ'y'eva gaṇḍamūlaṃ palikhataṃ me gaṇḍamūlan'ti bhāsati.

Sanskrit graha

gaṇhati 1

pr. (+acc) grabs hold (of); seizes; takes [√gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning grabs hold (of); seizes; takes
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction gaṇhā + ti
Synonym gāhayati, gheppati
Variant gaṇhāti
Sanskrit gṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṃ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṃ rathaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
gaṇhati 2

pr. (+acc) takes; accepts; receives [√gah] ✗
gaṇhanta

Grammar prp of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking; holding
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction gaṇhā + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym aggaṇhanta
Sanskrit grahṇat
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

yattha pana mahantaṃ paribhavaṃ paṭilabhati, tattha ciram'pi vasati. so nivatth'avatthe jiṇṇe pilotikakhaṇḍena tasmim'pi jiṇṇe kenaci dinnaṃ aggaṇhanto hirikopīnapaṭicchādanamatten'eva carati. evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.

gaṇhāti 1

Variant gaṇhati

Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

atth'ābhisamayā dhīro,
paṇḍito'ti pavuccatī'ti.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

gaha'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato ppa ṇhā'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. gheppati, gaṇhāti.

Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

ANa 2.23 bālavaggo vaṇṇanā

ath'eko lolamakkaṭo rukkhā otaritvā tassa piṭṭhiṃ abhiruhitvā uccārapassāvaṃ katvā siṅge gaṇhitvā olambanto naṅguṭṭhe gahetvā dolāyantova kīḷi

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
gata 1

pp. (+acc) gone (to); went (for) [√gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of gacchati (+acc)
Meaning gone (to); went (for)
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym āgata, agata
Synonym gatāse
Sanskrit gata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajja't'agge pāṇ'upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

AN 4.70 adhammikasuttaṃ
gata 2

pp. become (a certain way); being in (some state); gone into (a state) [√gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of gacchati
Meaning become (a certain way); being in (some state); gone into (a state)
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym agata
Sanskrit gata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ

idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
gata 3

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
gata 4

nt. going; walking; lit. gone [√gam + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of gacchati
Meaning going; walking; lit. gone
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Synonym gamana, caraṇa
Commentary (MNa) gate'ti gamane.
Sanskrit gata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
gata 5

pp. walked; travelled [√gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of gacchati
Meaning walked; travelled
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Synonym ciṇṇa
Sanskrit gata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā maggo gato hoti. tassa evaṃ hoti, ahaṃ kho maggaṃ agamāsiṃ. maggaṃ kho pana me gacchantassa kāyo kilanto. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
gatagataṭṭhāna

nt. every place gone to; lit. gone gone place [gata + gata + ṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning every place gone to; lit. gone gone place
Construction gata + gata + ṭhāna
Commentary (VINt) gatagataṭṭhāne'ti ... sampattasampattaṭṭhāne.
gataṭṭhāna 1

nt. place where one has gone [gata + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place where one has gone
Construction gata + ṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (gata + ṭhāna)
Sanskrit gata + sthāna

Example

sace me gataṭṭhāne dhītu doso uppajjati, tumhehi sodhetabbo.

DHPa 1.4.8 visākhā vatthu

Sanskrit gata + sthāna
gatatta 1.1

nt. fact of having gone [√gam] ✗
gatatta 2.1

gataddha

Construction gata + pubba

Sanskrit gata + pūrva

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi disaṃ peseti, yadi vā gatapubbaṃ yadi vā agatapubbaṃ, taṃ khippam'eva gantā hoti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo gantā hoti.

pahu santo na bharati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
gatāse

pp. (+acc) gone (to); went (for) [√gam + ta + āse] ✓

Construction √gam + ta + āse
gata + āse
Phonetic Change mt > t
Synonym gata
Commentary (SNt) gatāse'ti gatā eva.
Sanskrit gatāḥ
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ye keci buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatāse,
na te gamissanti apāyabhūmiṃ,
pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
devakāyaṃ paripūressantī'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

vimokkho yesaṃ gocaro,

gati tesaṃ durannayā.

attā hi attano gati,
tasmā saññamay'attānaṃ,
assaṃ bhadraṃ'va vāṇijo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gadrabho gogaṇaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi dammo, aham'pi dammo'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma gadrabho vahacchinno sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
gadrabhapañhajātaka

nt. Jātaka 111 (JA 111) ✗
gadrabhasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.83 (AN3.83) ✗
gadhita 1

pp. (+loc) tied up (by); tied (to); bound (to); enslaved (by) [√gadh + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of √gadh (+loc)
Meaning tied up (by); tied (to); bound (to); enslaved (by)
Root Family √gadh
Root √gadh×1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √gadh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym agadhita
Synonym ābaddha, paṭibaddha, patibaddha, baddha, saññutta, saṃyutta, sita
Variant gathita
Sanskrit grathita
Sanskrit Root √grath 1, 7, 9 (tie)

Examples

rittassa munino carato,
kāmesu anapekkhino,
oghatiṇṇassa pihayanti,
kāmesu gadhitā pajā'ti.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ gadhitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

gantabba 1

ptp. (+instr) should go; lit. to be gone [√gam + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of gacchati (+instr)
Meaning should go; lit. to be gone
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change m > n
Sanskrit gantavya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

no ce abhinipphādeyya, yat'assa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, tattha sāmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ, dūto vā pāhetabbo, yaṃ kho tumhe āyasmanto bhikkhuṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇittha, na taṃ tassa bhikkhuno kiñci atthaṃ anubhoti

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ

ahañ'hi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan'ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, satt'āhakaraṇīyena, appahite'pi, pag'eva pahite.

VIN 4.3.110 pañcannaṃ appahitepi anujānanā
gantabba 2

ptp. (+instr) should be travelled (by); must be journeyed (by); lit. to be gone [√gam + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of gacchati (+instr)
Meaning should be travelled (by); must be journeyed (by); lit. to be gone
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change m > n
Sanskrit gantavya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

maggo me gantabbo bhavissati. maggaṃ kho pana me gacchantassa kāyo kilamissati. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ

gantabba 4

Grammar ptp of gacchati (+instr)
Meaning (of a conclusion) should be reached; should be come to; should be arrived at; lit. to be gone

Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change m > n
Sanskrit gantavya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atthi devā'ti, bhāradvāja, puṭṭho samāno atthi devā'ti yo vadeyya, ṭhānaso me viditā'ti, yo vadeyya, atha khv'ettha viññunā purisena ekaṃsena niṭṭhaṃ gantabbaṃ yadidaṃ, atthi devā'ti. kissa pana me bhavaṃ gotamo ādiken'eva na byākāsī'ti.

MN 100 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
gantar 1

masc. visitor; lit. goer [√gam + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from gacchati
Meaning visitor; lit. goer
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change m > n
Sanskrit gantṛ
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ārāmaṃ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike dhammassavanāya

AN 3.30 avakujjasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi disaṃ peseti, yadi vā gatapubbaṃ yadi vā agatapubbaṃ, taṃ khippam'eva gantā hoti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo gantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
gantar 2

masc. goer; who goes [√gam + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from gacchati
Meaning goer; who goes
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym agantar
Sanskrit gantṛ
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño nāgo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgaṃtv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi pañcahi? idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā ca hoti, hantā ca, rakkhitā ca, khantā ca, gantā ca.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
gantukāma

adj. (+acc or +dat) wishing to go (to); wanting to go (to) [gantuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+acc or +dat)
Meaning wishing to go (to); wanting to go (to)
Construction gantuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (gantuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit gantukāma

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti

pr. is suitable to go; is fit to go; lit. is worthy to go [gantuṃ + arahati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning is suitable to go; is fit to go; lit. is worthy to go
Construction gantuṃ + arahati

Sanskrit gantum + arhati

Example

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

gilānā nāma bhikkhunī na sakkoti ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā gantuṃ.

VIN 2.5.3.3 bhikkhunupassayasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning having gone (to); having travelled (to)
Root Family √gam

Construction √gam + tvā
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym āgantvā
Synonym gantvāna
Sanskrit gatvā, gatvāya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

yo ve parakulaṃ gantvā,
bhutvāna sucibhojanaṃ,
āgataṃ nappaṭipūjeti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

vīriyaṃ me dhuradhorayhaṃ,
yogakkhem'ādhivāhanaṃ,
gacchati anivattantaṃ,
yattha gantvā na socati.

gantha 1

masc. (mental) tie; knot; bond [√ganth + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gantheti
Meaning (mental) tie; knot; bond
Root Family √ganth
Root √ganth･8 *e (tie, bind)
Construction √ganth + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym saṅga, saṃyoga
Variant gattha
Sanskrit grantha
Sanskrit Root √granth √grath 1, 7, 9 (tie)

Examples

taṃ v'āpi ganthaṃ kusalā vadanti,
yaṃ nissito passati hīnam'aññaṃ,
tasmā hi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sīlabbataṃ bhikkhu na nissayeyya.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā,
paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā,
saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ,
te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

gandha 1

masc. smell; scent; odour [√ghā + na] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning smell; scent; odour
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction √ghā + na
Derivative kita (na)
Sanskrit gandha

Examples

ye te ghānaviññeyyā gandhā aghāyitā aghāyitapubbā, na ca ghāyasi, na ca te hoti ghāyeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā piyarūpe gandhe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe gandhe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
gandha 2

masc. perfume; fragrance; scent [√ghā + na] ✓

Meaning perfume; fragrance; scent
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction √ghā + na
Derivative kita (na)
Commentary (MNa) gandhan'ti yaṃkiñci gandhajātaṃ
Sanskrit gandha
Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

Examples

na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.

DHP 55 pupphavaggo
gandhajātasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.80 (AN3.80) ✗
gandhataṇhā

fem. craving for smell [gandha + taṇhā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving for smell
Construction gandha + taṇhā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gandhe + taṇhā)
Sanskrit gandha + tṛṣṇā

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

rūpataṇhā... saddataṇhā... gandhataṇhā... rasataṇhā... phoṭṭhabbataṇhā... dhammataṇhā loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
gandhatindukajātaka

nt. Jātaka 520 (JA 520) ✗
gandhatela

nt. fragrant oil; scented oil [gandha + tela] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fragrant oil; scented oil
Construction gandha + tela
Compound kammadhāraya (gandha + tela)
Sanskrit gandhataila

Example

gandhatelappadittena,
dīpena tamadhaṃsinā,
tilokadīpaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā
gandhatthena

gandhaparibhāvita

adj. scent-infused; pervaded with perfume [gandha + paribhāvita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning scent-infused; pervaded with perfume
Construction gandha + paribhāvita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gandhena + paribhāvita)
Sanskrit gandha + paribhāvita

Example

tam'enaṃ sāmikā gandhaparibhāvite karaṇḍake nikkhipanti. yo'pi'ssa hoti anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato, so'pi samugghātaṃ gacchati.

gandhabba 1

masc. demigod; heavenly musician; class of mythological beings ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning demigod; heavenly musician; class of mythological beings
Notes see MW gandharva
Sanskrit gandharva

Examples

attadantassa posassa,
niccaṃ saññatacārino,
n'eva devo na gandhabbo,
na māro saha brahmunā,
jitaṃ apajitaṃ kayirā,
tathārūpassa jantuno.

DHP 104-105 sahassavaggo

tatr'ime bhūtā, timi timiṅgalo timitimiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
gandhabba 2

masc. stream of consciousness impelled to be reborn ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning stream of consciousness impelled to be reborn
Commentary (MNa) gandhabbo'ti tatr'ūpagasatto. paccupaṭṭhito hotī'ti na mātāpitūnaṃ sannipātaṃ olokayamāno samīpe ṭhito paccupaṭṭhito nāma hoti. kammayantayantito pana eko satto tasmiṃ okāse nibbattanako hotī'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo.
Sanskrit gandharva

Example

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

gandhavicāra

masc. pondering about smell; contemplating scent [gandha + vicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pondering about smell; contemplating scent
Construction gandha + vicāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gandhaṃ + vicāra)
Sanskrit gandha + vicāra

Example

rūpavicāro loke ... saddavicāro loke ... gandhavicāro loke ... rasavicāro loke ... phoṭṭhabbavicāro loke ... dhammavicāro loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
gandhasaññā

fem. recognition of scent; perception of smells [gandha + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of scent; perception of smells
Construction gandha + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gandhānaṃ + saññā)
Sanskrit gandha + saṃjñā

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave ... se āyatane veditabbe yattha ghānaṃ ca nirujjhati, gandhasaññā ca nirujjhati, se āyatane veditabbe yattha jivhā ca nirujjhati, rasasaññā ca nirujjhati

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cha'y'imā, bhikkhave, saññā, rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā.

gandhika

adj. fragrant; perfumed; scented; lit. with smell [√ghā + na + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from gandha
Meaning fragrant; perfumed; scented; lit. with smell
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction √ghā + na + ika
gandha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym gandhavant, gandhī
Sanskrit gandhika
Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

Example

sudhotarajapacchadaṃ subhaṃ,
goṇakatūlikasanthataṃ navaṃ,
abhiruha sayanaṃ mah'ārahaṃ,
candanamaṇḍitasāragandhikaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
gandhī

adj. fragrant; perfumed; scented; lit. with smell [√ghā + na + ī] ✓

ghanda + ī

Sanskrit gandhin

Example

sugandhikāyavadanaṃ,
anantaguṇagandhinaṃ,
sugandhin'āhaṃ gandhena,
pūjayāmi tathāgataṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
gabbita

adj. proud, arrogant [√gabbh] ✗
gabbha 1

masc. womb ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning womb
Synonym kucchi, gabbhara, yoni, lohitakumbhī
Commentary (MNa) katthaci hi gabbho'ti mātukucchi vutto.
Notes from sk √grabh to conceive
Sanskrit garbha

Examples

gabbham'eke uppajjanti,
nirayaṃ pāpakammino,
saggaṃ sugatino yanti,
parinibbanti anāsavā.

DHP 126 pāpavaggo

tena saccena sotthi te hotu sotthi gabbhassā'ti

MN 86 aṅgulimālasuttaṃ
gabbha 2

masc. embryo ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning embryo
Commentary (MNa) katthaci gabbhe nibbattanasatto.
Notes from sk √grabh to conceive
Sanskrit garbha

Example

phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti,
phalaṃ veḷuṃ phalaṃ naḷaṃ,
sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti,
gabbho assatariṃ yathā'ti.

SN 6.12 devadattasuttaṃ
gabbha 3

masc. room; inside room; inner chamber; lit. womb ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning room; inside room; inner chamber; lit. womb
Synonym ovaraka
Sanskrit garbha

Example

nikkaḍḍheyyā'ti gabbhe gahetvā pamukhaṃ nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. pamukhe gahetvā bahi nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ekena payogena bahuke'pi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.2.7 anupakhajjasikkhāpadaṃ
gabbha 4

Meaning offspring; generation; germination; lit. womb
Sanskrit garbha

Example

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo, satta saññīgabbhā, satta asaññīgabbhā, satta nigaṇṭhigabbhā

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
gabbhakaraṇa

nt. causing impregnation; assisting with conception; lit. embryo making [gabbha + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning causing impregnation; assisting with conception; lit. embryo making
Construction gabbha + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gabbhaṃ + karaṇa)
Sanskrit garbhakaraṇa

Example

āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.

aṭṭhakavaggo 14

TH 261 mahākassapattheragāthā
gabbhara 2

nt. womb; lit. cave [gabbha + ra] ~

Grammar nt, from gabbha
Meaning womb; lit. cave
Construction gabbha + ra
Derivative taddhita (ra)
Synonym kucchi, gabbha, yoni, lohitakumbhī
Commentary (SNa) gabbharasmin'ti ... mātukucchismiṃ
Sanskrit gahvara
gabbhavuṭṭhāna

nt. child-birth, delivery ✗
gabbhavokkanti

fem. coming into being of the fetus in the womb; conception ✗
gabbhaseyyaka

adj. who is born in an uterus, viviparous ✗
gabbhaseyyā

fem. conception in a womb; lit. lying in a womb [gabbha + seyyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning conception in a womb; lit. lying in a womb
Construction gabbha + seyyā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gabbhasmiṃ + seyyā)
Sanskrit garbha + śayyā

Examples

chetvā āsavāni ālayāni,
vidvā so na upeti gabbhaseyyaṃ,
saññaṃ tividhaṃ panujja paṅkaṃ,
kappaṃ n'eti tam'āhu ariyo'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
gabbhassāvakkanti

fem. conception; lit. descent of the foetus [gabbhassa + avakkanti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning conception; lit. descent of the foetus
Construction gabbhassa + avakkanti
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gabbhassa + avakkanti)
Commentary (MNa) gabbhassā'ti gabbhe nibbattanakasattassa. avakkanti hotī'ti nibbatti hoti.
Sanskrit garbhāvakrānti

Example

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
gabbhaṃ gaṇhati

idiom. becomes pregnant; lit. seize a womb ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning becomes pregnant; lit. seize a womb

Example

yathā balākayonimhi,
na vijjati pumo sadā,
meghesu gajjamānesu,
gabbhaṃ gaṇhanti tā sadā.

APA 511 tālaphaladāyaka therāpadānaṃ
gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti

idiom. conceives, becomes pregnant ✗
gabbhaṃ pātesi

idiom. had an abortion; lit. caused the embryo to fall ~

Grammar idiom, masc + aor
Meaning had an abortion; lit. caused the embryo to fall
gabbhāvakkanti

fem. conception; lit. descent of the embryo ✗
gabbhāvakkantidesanā

fem. teaching conception; lit. teaching the descent of the foetus [gabbhāvakkanti + desanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning teaching conception; lit. teaching the descent of the foetus
Construction gabbhāvakkanti + desanā
gabbhāsaya

masc. uterus ✗
gabbhinivagga

masc. sub-chapter on pregnant women [gabbhinī + vagga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sub-chapter on pregnant women
Construction gabbhinī + vagga
Variant gabbhinīvagga
gabbhinisañña

adj. (+loc) perceiving (someone) as pregnant [gabbhinī + sañña] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (someone) as pregnant
Construction gabbhinī + sañña
gabbhinisikkhāpada

nt. rule about being pregnant [gabbhinī + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about being pregnant
Construction gabbhinī + sikkhāpada
gabbhinī 1

adj. pregnant [gabbha + ī + iṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of gabbhī
Meaning pregnant
Construction gabbha + ī + iṇī
gabbhī + inī
Synonym gabbhī, māsācita
Sanskrit garbhiṇī

Examples

accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti

VIN 1.4.3.8 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, bārāṇasiyaṃ aññatarassa chapakassa pajāpati gabbhinī ahosi. atha kho, bhikkhave, sā chapakī taṃ chapakaṃ etadavoca, gabbhinī'mhi, ayyaputta!

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
gabbhinī 2

fem. pregnant woman [gabbha + ī + iṇī] ✓

Grammar fem, from gabbhī
Meaning pregnant woman
Construction gabbha + ī + iṇī
gabbhī + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Commentary (DNa) na gabbhiniyā'tiādīsu pana gabbhiniyā kucchiyaṃ dārako kilamati. pāyantiyā dārakassa khīr'antarāyo hoti, puris'antaragatāya ratiantarāyo hotī'ti na gaṇhati.
Sanskrit garbhiṇī

Examples

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhante, aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa jiṇṇassa vuḍḍhassa mahallakassa daharā māṇavikā pajāpatī ahosi gabbhinī upavijaññā.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
gabbhinīupamā

Meaning simile of the pregnant woman
Construction gabbhinī + upamā

Meaning sub-chapter on pregnant women
Construction gabbhinī + vagga
Variant gabbhinivagga
gabbhinīsutta

nt. Udāna 16 (UD 16) ✗

VIN 1.4.3.8 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
gama

adj. going; able to go [√gam + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from gacchati
Meaning going; able to go
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit gama
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso dāso assa anatt'ādhīno par'ādhīno na yenakāmaṃgamo

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

pañcavedā sataṃ samaṃ,
tapassī brāhmaṇā caraṃ,
cittañ'ca nesaṃ na sammā vimuttaṃ,
hīn'attharūpā na pāraṅ'gamā te.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
gamaṭṭhāna

nt. ruined village ✗
gamana 1

nt. going; walking; journeying; travelling [√gam + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from gacchati
Meaning going; walking; journeying; travelling
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym gata, caraṇa
Commentary (SNa) gamanenā'ti padagamanena.
Sanskrit gamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

gamanena na pattabbo,
lokass'anto kudācanaṃ,
na ca appatvā lok'antaṃ,
dukkhā atthi pamocanaṃ.

SN 2.26 rohitassasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ … na c'assa nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.

gamana 2

Construction √gam + ana

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning path; way; road; lit. going road

Example

ath'assa ratho samuddapiṭṭhena vegena gacchanto simbalivanaṃ pakkhanto, tassa gamanamagge simbalivanaṃ naḷavanaṃ viya chijjitvā chijjitvā samuddapiṭṭhe patati.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā
gamanasikkhāpada

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about leaving (a legal procedure without giving consent); Pācittiya 80
Construction gamana + sikkhāpada
gamanāgamana

nt. coming and going; travelling up and down [gamana + āgamana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning coming and going; travelling up and down
Construction gamana + āgamana
Compound dvanda (gamana ca āgamana ca)
Sanskrit gamanāgamana

Example

ekassa paccekabuddhassa jātassaraṃ oruyha nhāyantassa tīre ṭhapitesu kāsāvesu cīvaraṃ thenetvā tesaṃ hatthīnaṃ gamanāgamanamagge sattiṃ gahetvā sasīsaṃ pārupitvā nisīdati

DHPa 1.1.7 devadatta vatthu
gamanāgamanasampanna

adj. with an access road; easily accessible; lit. succeeded with going and coming [gamanāgamana + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with an access road; easily accessible; lit. succeeded with going and coming
Construction gamanāgamana + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gamanāgamanena + sampanna)
Commentary (ANt) tāya ca pana n'ātidūran'āccāsannatāya gocaraṭṭhānapaṭiparissay'ādirahitamaggatāya ca gamanassa ca āgamanassa ca yuttarūpattā gaman'āgamanasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit gamanāgamana + sampanna

Example

idha, bhikkhave, sen'āsanaṃ n'ātidūraṃ hoti n'āccāsannaṃ gaman'āgamanasampannaṃ divā appākiṇṇaṃ rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosaṃ appa-ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassaṃ

AN 10.11 senāsanasuttaṃ
gamanāya

nt. (+acc) to go (to); for going to see; for visiting [√gam + ana + āya] ✓

Grammar nt, dat sg of gamana (+acc)
Meaning to go (to); for going to see; for visiting
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ana + āya
gamana + āya
Sanskrit gamanāya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 49 senāvāsasikkhāpadaṃ
gamanīya 1

adj. leading to; going to; lit. to be gone [√gam + anīya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, ptp of gacchati
Meaning leading to; going to; lit. to be gone
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Synonym gatika, gāmī
Variant gāminiya
Sanskrit gamanīya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
gamanīya 2

ptp. (+instr) to be travelled (with); lit. to be gone [√gam + anīya] ✓

Grammar ptp of gacchati, in comps (+instr)
Meaning to be travelled (with); lit. to be gone
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit gamanīya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, satthagamanīyo hoti maggo, sāsaṅkasammato, sappaṭibhayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 27 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ
gami

aor. (+acc) went [√gam + i] ✓

Grammar aor of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning went
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + i
Variant agami, gamī
Sanskrit agamat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

hiyyattanī ajjatanī icc'etā vibhattiyo yadā māyogā, tadā sabbakāle ca honti. mā gamā, mā vacā, mā gamī, mā vacī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 420
gamika 1

masc. traveller; leaver; who is going on a journey [√gam + ika] ✓

Meaning traveller; leaver; who is going on a journey
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ika
Derivative kita (ika)

Example

āgantukassa dānaṃ deti, gamikassa dānaṃ deti, gilānassa dānaṃ deti, dubbhikkhe dānaṃ deti, yāni tāni navasassāni navaphalāni tāni paṭhamaṃ sīlavantesu patiṭṭhāpeti.

AN 5.36 kāladānasuttaṃ
gamika 2

adj. going away, setting out for a journey [√gam] ✗
gamikacitta

nt. intention to go on a journey; to leave ✗
gamikavatta

nt. preparation for a journey ✗
gamikābhisaṅkhāra

masc. intention to go; determination to go; lit. intention related to going [gamika + abhisaṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intention to go; determination to go; lit. intention related to going
Construction gamika + abhisaṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (gamika + abhisaṅkhāra)
Variant gamiyābhisaṅkhāra
Commentary (ANa) gamiy'ābhisaṅkhāro'ti hatthiyān'ādīnaṃ yojāpanagandhamāl'ādiggahaṇavasena pavatto payogo. so paṭippassambhī'ti so vūpasanto.
Sanskrit gamika + abhisaṃskāra

Example

samaṇo hi, sīha, gotamo akiriyavādo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī'ti. atha kho sīhassa senāpatissa yo ahosi gamik'ābhisaṅkhāro bhagavantaṃ dassanāya, so paṭippassambhi.

payutto te damessāmi,

te hi sotthiṃ gamissanti,
kacche vāmakase magā,
jhānāni upasampajja,
ekodi nipakā satā'ti.

SN 2.11 candimasasuttaṃ
gamissase

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 476

gamu'icc'etassa dhātussa anto makāro ccho hoti vā sabbāsu paccayavibhattīsu. gacchamāno, gacchanto. gacchati, gameti. gacchatu, gametu. gaccheyya. gameyya. agacchā, agamā. agacchī, agamī. gacchissati, gamissati. agacchissā, agamissā. gamisse'ti kim'atthaṃ? icchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 476
gameti 1

pr. (+acc) makes go (to); causes to go (to); causes to get; makes become [√gam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes go (to); causes to go (to); causes to get; makes become
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 *e (go)
Base √gam + e > game (caus)
Construction game + ti
Sanskrit gamayati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ, tam'enaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
gameti 2

pr. understands [√gam] ✗
gamenta

Base √gam + e > game (caus)

gamesi

aor. made go, sent, understood [√gam] ✗
gambhīra 1

adj. deep ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning deep
Synonym gambhīrarūpa
Sanskrit gambhīra

Examples

seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso mahatiṃ puthusilaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

yathā'pi rahado gambhīro,
vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna,
vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 82 paṇḍitavaggo
gambhīra 2

nt. deep water; depths; lit. deep ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning deep water; depths; lit. deep
Sanskrit gambhīra

Example

kathaṃsu tarati oghaṃ,
rattindivam'atandito,
appatiṭṭhe anālambe,
ko gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ
gambhīra 3

adj. profound; abstruse; hard to fathom; lit. deep ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning profound; abstruse; hard to fathom; lit. deep
Antonym uttāna
Commentary (SNa) gambhīran'ti gambhīr'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit gambhīra

Examples

ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīr'atthā lok'uttarā suññatappaṭisaṃyuttā, tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ

gambhīrapaññaṃ medhāviṃ,
magg'āmaggassa kovidaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 403 brāhmaṇavaggo
gambhīra 4

adj. (of voice) deep; rich; (comm) arising from deep ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning (of voice) deep; rich; (comm) arising from deep
Commentary (MNa) gambhīro'ti gambhīrasamuṭṭhito.
Sanskrit gambhīra

Example

aṭṭh'aṅgasamannāgato kho pan'assa bhoto gotamassa mukhato ghoso niccharati, vissaṭṭho ca, viññeyyo ca, mañju ca, savanīyo ca, bindu ca, avisārī ca, gambhīro ca, ninnādī ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
gambhīra 5

nt. deep pit; deep hole; lit. deep ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning deep pit; deep hole; lit. deep
Commentary (KPa) atthi gambhīrañ'c'eva odak'antikañ'ca jaṅgale bhūmibhāge yāva idāni udakaṃ āgamissatī'ti, tāva khato āvāṭo viya. taṃ sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ gambhīre odakantike'ti.
Sanskrit gambhīra

Example

nidhiṃ nidheti puriso,
gambhīre odak'antike,
atthe kicce samuppanne,
atthāya me bhavissati.

KP 1.8 nidhikaṇḍasuttaṃ
gambhīragata

adj. sunk deeply; plunged deeply; lit. gone deep [gambhīra + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sunk deeply; plunged deeply; lit. gone deep
Construction gambhīra + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + gata)
Sanskrit gambhīra + gata

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma gambhīre udapāne udakatārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti, evam'ev'assu me akkhikūpesu akkhitārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
gambhīratā

fem. deepness; profundity [gambhīra] ✗
gambhīratta 1

nt. (+gen) depth (of); deepness; lit. deep state [gambhīra + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from gambhīra (+gen)
Meaning depth (of); deepness; lit. deep state
Construction gambhīra + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit gambhīratva

Example

dakkhiṇāya ce'pi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, n'eva saṅkampeyya na sampakampeyya na sampacāleyya. taṃ kissa hetu? gambhīrattā, bhikkhave, nemassa sunikhātattā silāyūpassa.

SN 56.40 vādatthikasuttaṃ
gambhīratta 2

nt. (+gen) profundity (of); lit. deep state [gambhīra + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from gambhīra (+gen)
Meaning profundity (of); lit. deep state
Construction gambhīra + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit gambhīratva
gambhīrattha

adj. with deep meaning; profound in implication; whose meaning is profound [gambhīra + attha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with deep meaning; profound in implication; whose meaning is profound
Construction gambhīra + attha
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + attha)
Sanskrit gambhīra + artha

Example

ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīr'atthā lok'uttarā suññatappaṭisaṃyuttā, tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
gambhīranema

adj. with deeply rooted point, firmly established ✗
gambhīrapañña

adj. with profound understanding; having deep wisdom [gambhīra + pañña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with profound understanding; having deep wisdom
Construction gambhīra + pañña
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + pañña)
Sanskrit gambhīra + prajña

Example

gambhīrapaññaṃ medhāviṃ,
magg'āmaggassa kovidaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 403 brāhmaṇavaggo
gambhīrapaññatā

fem. state of deep wisdom; fact of having profound understanding [gambhīra + paññatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of deep wisdom; fact of having profound understanding
Construction gambhīra + paññatā
Commentary (PM) gambhīrapaññatāya saṃvattantī'ti katamā gambhīrapaññā? gambhīresu khandhesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīrāsu dhātūsu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīresu āyatanesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīresu paṭiccasamuppādesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā.
gambhīrapaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.65 (SN55.65) ✗
gambhīrapañha

nt. deep question; profound enquiry [gambhīra + pañha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning deep question; profound enquiry
Construction gambhīra + pañha
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + pañha)
Commentary (JAa) gambhīrapañhan'ti atthato ca pāḷito ca gambhīraṃ guḷhaṃ paṭicchannaṃ
Sanskrit gambhīra + praśna

Example

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yathā taṃ sutavatā sāvakena samma'd'eva satthusāsanaṃ ājānantena, evam'eva āyasmatā puṇṇena mantāṇiputtena gambhīrā gambhīrapañhā anumassa anumassa byākatā.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
gambhīrabhāva

masc. depth; profundity [gambhīra + bhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning depth; profundity
Construction gambhīra + bhāva
gambhīrarūpa

adj. deep; lit. deep in form [gambhīra + rūpa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deep; lit. deep in form
Construction gambhīra + rūpa
Synonym gambhīra
Commentary (SNa) gambhīrarūpe'ti gambhīrasabhāve.
gambhīrasita

adj. deeply furrowed; with a deep plough track [gambhīra + sītā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deeply furrowed; with a deep plough track
Construction gambhīra + sītā + a
gambhīrasītā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + sītā)
Commentary (ANa) na ca gambhīrasitan'ti thaddhabhūmitāya gambhīr'ānugataṃ, naṅgalamaggaṃ katvā kasituṃ na sakkā hoti, uttānanaṅgalamaggam'eva hoti.
Sanskrit gambhīra + sītā

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
gambhīrasīta

adj. yielding a deep furrow ✗
gambhīraṃ

ind. deeply [gambhīra + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of gambhīra
Meaning deeply
Construction gambhīra + aṃ
Sanskrit gambhīram
gambhīrāvabhāsa

adj. having the appearance of depth or profundity ✗
gambhīrobhāsa

adj. appearing deep; seemingly deep [gambhīra + obhāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning appearing deep; seemingly deep
Construction gambhīra + obhāsa
Commentary (ANa) uttāno gambhīr'obhāso'tiādīsu purāṇa-paṇṇa-rasa-sambhinna-vaṇṇo kāḷaudako gambhīr'obhāso nāma, accha-vippasanna-maṇivaṇṇa-udako uttān'obhāso nāma.
gamma 1

adj. vulgar; common; lit. of the village [gāma + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from gāma
Meaning vulgar; common; lit. of the village
Construction gāma + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Synonym gāma, pākata, pothujjana
Sanskrit grāmya

Example

na kāmasukham'anuyuñjeyya hīnaṃ gammaṃ pothujjanikaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ, na ca attakilamath'ānuyogam'anuyuñjeyya dukkhaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
gamma 2

ptp. what should be understood or attained [√gam] ✗
gammati

pr. is gone to [√gam] ✗
gayā 1

fem. name of a village ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a village
Sanskrit gayā

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, ādittaṃ.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ

addasā kho maṃ, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako antarā ca gayaṃ antarā ca bodhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṃ. disvāna maṃ etadavoca, vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto!

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
gayā 2

fem. name of a sacred river; (comm) circular pond ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a sacred river; (comm) circular pond
Commentary (MNa) gayā'ti'pi maṇḍalavāpisaṇṭhānaṃ tittham'eva vuccati.
Sanskrit gayā

Example

bāhukaṃ adhikakkañ'ca,
gayaṃ sundarikaṃ m'api,
sarassatiṃ payāgañ'ca,
atho bāhumatiṃ nadiṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
gayākassapattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 204 (TH204) ✗
gayāsīsa

nt. name of a rock hill near Gayā; lit. Gayā's head [gayā + sīsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a rock hill near Gayā; lit. Gayā's head
Construction gayā + sīsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gayāyaṃ + sīsa)
Commentary (UDa) gayāsīse'ti gajasīsasadisasikharo tattha eko pabbato gayāsīsanāmako, yattha hatthikumbhasadiso piṭṭhipāsāṇo bhikkhusahassassa okāso pahoti, tatra bhagavā viharati.
Sanskrit gayāśīrṣa (bsk)

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, ādittaṃ.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ
gayāsīsasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.64 (AN8.64) ✗
gayha 1

adj. fit to be taken, seized or gripped [√gah] ✗
gayha 2

nt. that which comes into one's grasp [√gah] ✗
gayha 3

ptp. to be held [√gah] ✗
gayhaka 1

masc. captive; prisoner; hostage; lit. who is seized [√gah + ya + aka] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from gayhati, pass
Meaning captive; prisoner; hostage; lit. who is seized
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ya (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ya > gayha (pass)
Construction gayha + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Synonym karamara, baddha, baddhagū
Commentary (SNa) gayhakaṃ nīyamānan'ti gahetvā nīyamānaṃ, karamaraṃ nīyamānan'ti'pi attho.
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
gayhaka 2

adj. having seized, captured [√gah] ✗
gayhati 1

pr. (+instr) (gram) is employed (by); is used (by); lit. is grasped [√gah + ya + ti] ~

Meaning (gram) is employed (by); is used (by); lit. is grasped
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ya (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ya > gayha (pass)
Construction gayha + ti
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit gṛhyate
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
gayhati 2

pr. (+instr) is taken or seized [√gah] ✗
gayhamāna

prp. was being taken or seized [√gah] ✗
gayhi

aor. was taken or seized [√gah] ✗
garahaka 1

adj. // [√garah + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from garahati
Meaning //
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + aka

Example

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīgarahakā pathavījigucchakā, āpagarahakā āpajigucchakā, tejagarahakā tejajigucchakā

garahaka 2

garahaṇa

nt. reproof; blame; rebuke [√garah] ✗
garahati

pr. (+acc) criticises; abuses; blames [√garah + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning criticises; abuses; blames

Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Base √garah + a > garaha
Construction garaha + ti
Sanskrit garhati
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

Examples

so bhuttāvī anumodati, na taṃ bhattaṃ garahati, na aññaṃ bhattaṃ paṭikaṅkhati, añña'd'atthu dhammiyā kathāya taṃ parisaṃ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

sammādiṭṭhiṃ ce bhavaṃ garahati, ye ca micchādiṭṭhī samaṇabrāhmaṇā te bhoto pujjā, te bhoto pāsaṃsā.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
garahana

nt. reproach, reproof [√garah] ✗
garahanta

prp. reproaching, blaming, scolding [√garah] ✗
garahappatta

adj. blamed; criticised [garahā + patta] ~

Meaning blamed; criticised
Construction garahā + patta
garahamāna

prp. reproaching, blaming, scolding [√garah] ✗
garahā

fem. blame; criticism [√garah + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from garahati
Meaning blame; criticism
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Antonym pasaṃsā, pasaṃsana
Synonym nindā
Sanskrit garhā
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

Examples

dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahā'va seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.

TH 245 godattattheragāthā

passati hi so, bhikkhave, gopālako tatonidānaṃ vadhaṃ vā bandhanaṃ vā jāniṃ vā garahaṃ vā.

garahi

Examples

appamādena maghavā,
devānaṃ seṭṭhataṃ gato,

pamādo garahito sadā.

DHP 30 appamādavaggo

puggal'ānādariyaṃ nāma upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno ayaṃ ukkhittako vā vambhito vā garahito vā, imassa vacanaṃ akataṃ bhavissatī'ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.4 anādariyasikkhāpadaṃ
garahitajātaka

nt. Jātaka 219 (JA 219) ✗
garahitabba

ptp. should be blamed; could be criticised; lit. to be blamed [√garah + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of garahati
Meaning should be blamed; could be criticised; lit. to be blamed
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Sanskrit garhitavya
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

Examples

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā imaṃ mahācattārīsakaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ garahitabbaṃ paṭikkositabbaṃ maññeyya tassa diṭṭh'eva dhamme dasasahadhammikā vād'ānuvādā gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchanti

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
garahitvā

abs. having reproached [√garah] ✗
garahiya

ger. reproaching [√garah] ✗
garahī

adj. criticising; blaming [√garah + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from garahati
Meaning criticising; blaming
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit garhin
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

Examples

yo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānaṃ,
chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni,
yam'ariyagarahī nirayaṃ upeti,
vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya pāpakan'ti.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ

ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
garu 1

adj. heavy; onerous; weighty [√gar + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning heavy; onerous; weighty
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym agaru
Synonym garuka
Sanskrit guru
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Example

nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ,
aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya,
samūlaṃ taṇham'abbuyha,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SN 22.22 bhārasuttaṃ
garu 2

adj. serious; burdensome; difficult; problematic; lit. heavy [√gar + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning serious; burdensome; difficult; problematic; lit. heavy
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym agaru
Sanskrit guru
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Examples

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

sace te kassapa agaru, viharemu ajjaṇho aggisālamhī'ti

VIN 4.1.12 uruvela pāṭihāriya kathā
garu 3

adj. respected; esteemed; giving weight to [√gar + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning respected; esteemed; giving weight to
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym agaru
Synonym garuka
Sanskrit guru
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Examples

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

āyasmā'ti piyavacanaṃ garuvacanaṃ sagāravasappatissādhivacanam'etaṃ āyasmā'ti.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa

AN 2.9 cariyasuttaṃ

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
garu 5

masc. respect; honour [√gar + u] ✓

Meaning respect; honour
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)

Commentary (MNa) garuṃ karontī'ti garukaraṇā.

Example

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
garuka 1

adj. heavy; onerous; weighty [√gar + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from garu
Meaning heavy; onerous; weighty
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u + ka
garu + ka

Antonym lahuka
Synonym garu
Sanskrit guruka
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Examples

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje labhetha otāran'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
garuka 2

adj. serious; grave; lit. heavy [√gar + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from garu
Meaning serious; grave; lit. heavy
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u + ka
garu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym bhāriya
Sanskrit guruka
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Examples

vedanaṃ pharusaṃ jāniṃ,
sarīrassa ca bhedanaṃ,
garukaṃ v'āpi ābādhaṃ,
cittakkhepañ'ca pāpuṇe.

DHP 138 daṇḍavaggo

apuññalābho ca gatī ca pāpikā,
bhītassa bhītāya ratī ca thokikā,
rājā ca daṇḍaṃ garukaṃ paṇeti,
tasmā naro paradāraṃ na seve.

DHP 310 nirayavaggo
garuka 3

adj. respected; esteemed; given importance; lit. heavy [√gar + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from garu
Meaning respected; esteemed; given importance; lit. heavy
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u + ka
garu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym garu
Sanskrit guruka
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Example

garuke mama satthusāsane,
yā sikkhā sugatena desitā,
parisuddhapadaṃ anaṅgaṇaṃ,
kiṃ maṃ ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
garukakamma

nt. heavy kamma ✗
garukata

pp. respected; honoured; revered; lit. made heavy [garu + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of garukaroti, comp vb
Meaning respected; honoured; revered; lit. made heavy
Construction garu + kata
Compound comp verb (garu + kata)
Antonym agarukata
Synonym apacita, pūjita, vandita, sakkata, sammata
Sanskrit gurukṛta

Examples

dibbāni'pi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya. na kho, ānanda, ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bāhiyo dārucīriyo suppārake paṭivasati samuddatīre sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito lābhī cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
garukatvā

abs. having honoured; having esteemed; having paid respect [garu + katvā] ~

Grammar abs of garuṃ karoti, comp vb
Meaning having honoured; having esteemed; having paid respect
Construction garu + katvā
Synonym purakkhatvā, vanditvā
garukaraṇa

adj. which creates respect; which makes one revered [garu + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which creates respect; which makes one revered
Construction garu + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (garuṃ + karaṇa)
Commentary (ANa) yo te dhamme pūreti, taṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ ... garuṃ karontī'ti garukaraṇā.
Sanskrit guru + karaṇa

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 6.12 dutiyasāraṇīyasuttaṃ
garukari

aor. respected, revered ✗
garukariyamāna

prp. (+instr) being respected (by); being honoured (by); being revered (by) [garu + kariyamāna] ✓

Grammar prp of garukarīyati, comp vb, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being respected (by); being honoured (by); being revered (by)
Construction garu + kariyamāna
Compound comp verb (garu + kariyamāna)
Synonym pūjiyamāna, māniyamāna, sakkariyamāna
Sanskrit gurum + kriyamāṇa

Example

etha, tumhe bhikkhū sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme sakkarotha garuṃ karotha mānetha pūjetha, app'eva nāma tumhehi sakkariyamānānaṃ garukariyamānānaṃ māniyamānānaṃ pūjiyamānānaṃ siyā cittassa aññathattaṃ, yathā taṃ dūsī māro labhetha otāran'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
garukarīyati

pr. (+instr) is respected; is honoured; is revered ✗
garukaroti

pr. respects, reveres ✗
garukaronta

prp. respecting; honouring; revering; lit. making heavy [garu + karonta] ✓

Grammar prp of garukaroti, comp vb
Meaning respecting; honouring; revering; lit. making heavy
Construction garu + karonta
Compound comp verb (garu + karonta)
Synonym namassanta, mānenta, sakkaronta
Variant garuṃ karonta
Sanskrit guru + kurvat

Example

yo ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ'y'eva sakkaronto, dhammaṃ garukaronto, dhammaṃ mānento, dhammaṃ pūjento, dhammaṃ apacāyamāno suvaco hoti, sovacassataṃ āpajjati, tam'ahaṃ suvaco'ti vadāmi.

garukāpatti

Meaning serious offence; grave transgression

Example

idh'upāli, bhikkhū anāpattiṃ āpattī'ti dīpenti, āpattiṃ anāpattī'ti dīpenti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ garuk'āpattī'ti dīpenti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ lahuk'āpattī'ti dīpenti

AN 10.43 dutiyavivādamūlasuttaṃ
garukāra

masc. respect; reverence; adoration; lit. making heavy [garu + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from garukaroti
Meaning respect; reverence; adoration; lit. making heavy
Construction garu + kāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (garuṃ + kāra)
Synonym gārava
Sanskrit gurukāra

Example

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning for the sake of reverence; for the sake of adoration

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
garugabbhā

adj. very pregnant; due; lit. heavy womb [garu + gabbhā] ✓

Meaning very pregnant; due; lit. heavy womb

Compound kammadhāraya (garu + gabbhā)
Sanskrit guru + garbha

Example

tadā seṭṭhino bhariyā garugabbhā hoti. tasmā so sīghaṃ gehaṃ purisaṃ pesesi, gaccha bhaṇe, jānāhi naṃ vijātā vā, no vā'ti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
garugara

adj. very heavy; extremely full [garu + garu + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very heavy; extremely full
Construction garu + garu + a
garugaru + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (MNa) garugaro viyā'ti garukagaruko viya thaddho pāsāṇapuñjasadiso
Sanskrit guru + guru

Example

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
garutta 2

nt. heaviness [√gar] ✗
garudhamma 1

masc. important or exacting rule of observances (perhaps an observance of respect?), one of the eight specific rules of behaviour imposed on nuns ✗
garudhamma 2

masc. important or serious offence; breach of serious rule of observance ✗

Construction garu + dhamma + ā
garudhamma + ā

Sanskrit gurudharma (bsk)

Example

ovadeyyā'ti aṭṭhahi garudhammehi ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa. aññena dhammena ovadati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. ekatoupasampannaṃ ovadati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

Grammar masc, comp

Variant garumbhāra
Sanskrit gurubhāra

Example

tam'enaṃ, bhikkhave, mātā nava vā dasa vā māse gabbhaṃ kucchinā pariharati mahatā saṃsayena garubhāraṃ. tam'enaṃ, bhikkhave, mātā navannaṃ vā dasannaṃ vā māsānaṃ accayena vijāyati mahatā saṃsayena garubhāraṃ.

garuvacana

nt. expression of respect or esteem ✗

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata mam'eva bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyuṃ, na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyun'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
gala 1.1

adj. dripping; oozing [√gal + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from galati
Meaning dripping; oozing
Root Family √gal
Root √gal･1 a (drip, flow)
Construction √gal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym pagghariṇī, paggharī, sandana
Variant gaḷa
Notes PED suggests √gil
Sanskrit gala
Sanskrit Root √gal 1 (drop)

Example

āyasmā visākho pañcālaputto upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti ... poriyā vācāya vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pariyāpannāya anissitāya

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.

galaka

masc. throat; neck ✗

masc. throttling; choking ✗

masc. taking by the neck, throttling ✗

pr. drips, flows, trickles [√gal] ✗
galanāḷi

fem. larynx ✗
galanta

prp. flowing; dripping; trickling; oozing [√gal + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of galati, intrans
Meaning flowing; dripping; trickling; oozing
Root Family √gal
Root √gal･1 a (drip, flow)
Base √gal + a > gala
Construction gala + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym paggharanta, paggharamāna
Variant gaḷanta
Sanskrit galat
Sanskrit Root √gal 1 (drop)

Example

atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷī dāsī bhinnena sīsena lohitena galantena paṭivissakānaṃ ujjhāpesi, passath'ayye, soratāya kammaṃ, passath'ayye, nivātāya kammaṃ, passath'ayye, upasantāya kammaṃ!

Meaning medicinal creeper; Tinospora cordifolia
Construction galoci + latā
Synonym gaḷocī
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinospora_cordifolia
gava

masc. cow; cattle [go + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, from go
Meaning cow; cattle
Construction go > gav + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change o > av
Synonym go
Sanskrit gava

Example

aj'eḷakapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, hatthigava-assavaḷavāpaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti

gavassa

nt. cows and horses [gava + assa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cows and horses
Construction gava + assa
Compound dvanda (gava ca assa ca)
Variant gavāssa
Sanskrit gava + aśva

Example

khettaṃ vatthuṃ hiraññaṃ vā,
gav'assaṃ dāsaporisaṃ,
thiyo bandhū puthu kāme,
yo naro anugijjhati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
gavassadhanahārī

Meaning stealing cows, horses and wealth
Construction gava + assa + dhana + hārī
gavā

masc. from cow [go + *a + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of go, irreg
Meaning from cow
Construction go > gav + *a + ā
gava + ā
Phonetic Change o > av
Sanskrit gvāḥ

Example

seyyathā'pi, citta, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo. yasmiṃ samaye khīraṃ hoti, n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dadhī'ti saṅkhaṃ gacchati

DN 9.7 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, tayo attapaṭilābhā
gavākappa

masc. bodily behaviour of a cow; cow's physical manner [gava + ākappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bodily behaviour of a cow; cow's physical manner
Construction gava + ākappa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāvassa + ākappa)
Variant gvākappa
Commentary (MNa) gav'ākappan'ti goākappaṃ. sesaṃ kukkurākappe vuttasadisam'eva. yathā pana tattha aññe kukkure disvā dante vivaritvā gaman'ākāro, evam'idha aññe gāvo disvā kaṇṇe ukkhipitvā gaman'ākāro veditabbo. sesaṃ t'ādisam'eva
Sanskrit go + ākalpa

Example

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1

gavesaka

adj. who seeks or looks for [√gaves] ✗
gavesati 1

pr. (+acc) seeks (for); searches (for); looks (for) [√gaves + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning seeks (for); searches (for); looks (for)
Root Family √gaves
Root √gaves･1 a (seek, search)
Base √gaves + a > gavesa
Construction gavesa + ti
Synonym abhipassati, esati, pariyesati
Sanskrit gaveṣate
Sanskrit Root √gaveṣ 1, 10 (seek, search)

Example

ko nu hāso kim'ānando,
niccaṃ pajjalite sati,
andhakārena onaddhā,
padīpaṃ na gavesatha.

DHP 146 jarāvaggo
gavesati 2

pr. (+acc) wishes (for); want to make [√gaves + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishes (for); want to make
Root Family √gaves
Root √gaves･1 a (seek, search)
Base √gaves + a > gavesa
Construction gavesa + ti
Commentary (THIa) candaṃ kīḷanakaṃ gavesasi candamaṇḍalaṃ kīḷāgoḷakaṃ kātu'kāmo'si
Sanskrit gaveṣate
Sanskrit Root √gaveṣ 1, 10 (seek, search)

Example

apathena payātum'icchasi,
candaṃ kīḷanakaṃ gavesasi,
meruṃ laṅghetum'icchasi,
yo tvaṃ buddhasutaṃ maggayasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
gavesana

nt. search, seeking [√gaves] ✗
gavesanā

fem. search, seeking [√gaves] ✗
gavesanta

prp. (+acc) seeking; searching (for); looking (for) [√gaves + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gavesati, trans (+acc)
Meaning seeking; searching (for); looking (for)
Root Family √gaves
Root √gaves･1 a (seek, search)
Base √gaves + a > gavesa
Construction gavesa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym anvesanta, abhipassanta, esanta, esamāna, esāna, pariyesamāna, maggayamāna
Sanskrit gaveṣat
Sanskrit Root √gaveṣ 1, 10 (seek, search)

Example

anekajātisaṃsāraṃ,
sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakārakaṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

DHP 153 jarāvaggo
gavesamāna

prp. seeking, searching for, striving after [√gaves] ✗

aor. sought, searched for, strove after [√gaves] ✗
gavesita

pp. sought, searched for, striven after [√gaves] ✗
