gavesitvā

abs. having sought, having searched for, having striven after [√gaves] ✗
gavesiya

ger. seeking, searching for, striving after [√gaves] ✗
gavesī 1

adj. (+acc) seeking; searching for; looking for [√gaves + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from gavesati (+acc)
Meaning seeking; searching for; looking for
Root Family √gaves
Root √gaves･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √gaves + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Commentary (MNa) gavesī'ti ... gavesamāno
Sanskrit gaveṣin
Sanskrit Root √gaveṣ 1, 10 (seek, search)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya

gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā.

Trad

gahaka

nt. body; lit. small house [√gah + a + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, dimin of gaha
Meaning body; lit. small house
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + a + ka
gaha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym kaḷebara, kaḷevara, kāyadhātu, deha, bhastā, sandeha, samussaya, sarīra
Commentary (THa) aniccāni gahakāni, tattha tattha punappunan'ti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ bhave punappunaṃ nibbattamānāni gahakāni attabhāvagehāni na nibbāni anavaṭṭhitāni ittarāni parittakālāni.
Sanskrit gṛhaka
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

aniccāni gahakāni,
tattha tattha punappunaṃ,
gahakāraṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

DHP 154 jarāvaggo
gahaṭṭha

masc. householder; layperson; lit. staying in a house [gaha + ṭha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning householder; layperson; lit. staying in a house
Construction gaha + ṭha

Antonym anāgāra, paribbāja
Synonym gihī
Sanskrit gṛhastha

Examples

asaṃsaṭṭhaṃ gahaṭṭhehi,
anāgārehi c'ūbhayaṃ,
anokasārim'app'icchaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 404 brāhmaṇavaggo

yo buddhaṃ paribhāsati,
atha vā tassa sāvakaṃ,
paribbājaṃ gahaṭṭhaṃ vā,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

VIN 2.5.9.1 antepurasikkhāpadaṃ
gahaṇika 2

Meaning digestion; lit. grasper
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + aṇa + ī
gahaṇa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Synonym pariṇāma
Commentary (DNa) gahaṇiyā'ti kammajatejodhātuyā. tattha yassa bhuttabhutto āhāro jīrati, yassa vā pana puṭabhattaṃ viya tatheva tiṭṭhati, ubhopete na samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgatā. yassa pana bhuttakāle bhattacchando uppajjat'eva, ayaṃ samavepākiniyā samannāgato.
Sanskrit grahaṇī
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'ābādho hoti app'ātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato n'ātisītāya n'āccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
gahaṇī 2

fem. womb; uterus [√gah] ✗
gahaṇī 3

fem. gestation [√gah] ✗
gahati

pr. immerses, penetrates, plunges into [√gāh] ✗
gahana 1

adj. thick; dense; lit. grabbing [√gah + ana] ✓

Grammar adj, from gaṇhāti
Meaning thick; dense; lit. grabbing
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym appita, gāḷha, tibba, bahala, sanda
Sanskrit gahana
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

pañcadosavivajjitan'ti, pañc'ime caṅkamadosā nāma, thaddhavisamatā, antorukkhatā, gahanacchannatā, atisambādhatā, ativisālatā'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
gahana 2

nt. tangle; thicket; impenetrable jungle; dense forest; lit. grabbing [√gah + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from gaṇhāti
Meaning tangle; thicket; impenetrable jungle; dense forest; lit. grabbing
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit gahana
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca hoti, balavanissito ca hoti. kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti?

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha,
kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ,
bāhiraṃ parimajjasī'ti.

JA 138 godhajātakaṃ
gahana 3

nt. complicated mess; intricate tangle; impenetrable complexity; lit. grabbing [√gah + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from gaṇhāti
Meaning complicated mess; intricate tangle; impenetrable complexity; lit. grabbing
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit gahana
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā evaṃ manussagahane evaṃ manussakasaṭe evaṃ manussasāṭheyye vattamāne sattānaṃ hit'āhitaṃ jānāti. gahanañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ manussā, uttānakañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ pasavo.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
gahanaṭṭhāna

nt. impenetrable place in a jungle ✗
gahananissita

adj. depending on dense jungle; relying on thickets [gahana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning depending on dense jungle; relying on thickets
Construction gahana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gahanaṃ + nissita)

Examples

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

Construction gahana + upavicāra
Commentary (ANa) gahane nilīyanaṭṭhāne etesaṃ mano upavicaratī'ti gahan'ūpavicārā.
gahapata

adj. given by householders; from laypeople [gaha + pati + a] ~

Grammar adj, comp, from gahapati
Meaning given by householders; from laypeople
Construction gaha + pati + a
gahapati + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym gahapatika
Sanskrit gṛhapatika (bsk)
gahapataggi

masc. fire (of hell for the unfaithful wife) of a householder; lit. household fire [gahapati + aggi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire (of hell for the unfaithful wife) of a householder; lit. household fire
Construction gahapati + aggi
Commentary (DNa) gahapatī'ti pana gehasāmiko vuccati. So mātugāmassa sayanavatth'ālaṅkār'ādianuppadānena bah'ūpakāro. taṃ aticaranto mātugāmo niray'ādīsu nibbattati, tasmā so'pi purimanayen'eva anudahan'aṭṭhena gahapat'aggī'ti vutto.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + agni
gahapatānī

fem. householder’s wife; lady of the house [gaha + pati + anī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp, from gahapati
Meaning householder’s wife; lady of the house
Construction gaha + pati + anī
gahapati + anī
Derivative taddhita (anī)
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahassa + patānī)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) gahapatānī nāma yā kāci agāraṃ ajjhāvasati. (MNa) gahapatānī'ti gharasāminī.
Sanskrit gṛhapatnī

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imissā'y'eva sāvatthiyā vedehikā nāma gahapatānī ahosi. vedehikāya, bhikkhave, gahapatāniyā evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato, soratā vedehikā gahapatānī, nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ
gahapati

masc. householder; landowner; lit. house master [gaha + pati] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning householder; landowner; lit. house master
Construction gaha + pati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahassa + pati)
Synonym gahapatika
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) gahapati nāma yo koci agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
Sanskrit gṛhapati

Examples

sakkā ca pan'etaṃ abhavissa kātuṃ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyā'pi, hand'āhaṃ acelako homi, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

tena hi, gahapati, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi, yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi.

AN 3.73 ājīvakasuttaṃ
gahapatika 1

masc. householder; landowner [gaha + pati + ka] ✓

Meaning householder; landowner
Construction gaha + pati + ka
gahapati + ka

Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.10) gahapatiko nāma ṭhapetvā rājaṃ rājabhoggaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ avaseso gahapatiko nāma.
Sanskrit gṛhapati, gārhapatika (bsk)

Examples

yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

ko nu kho bho kaccāna hetu ko paccayo yena khattiyā'pi khattiyehi vivadanti brāhmaṇā'pi brāhmaṇehi vivadanti gahapatikā'pi gahapatikehi vivadantī'ti?

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhāti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

gahapaticīvara

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning robe offered by a householder
Construction gahapati + cīvara

Commentary (VINa) gahapaticīvaran'ti gahapatīhi dinnacīvaraṃ.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + cīvara

Example

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā pahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti gām'antavihārī nemantaniko gahapaticīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti.

Examples

puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, visārado'va upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.

AN 5.35 dānānisaṃsasuttaṃ

aṭṭha kho imā, sāriputta, parisā. katamā aṭṭha? khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṃsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā, imā kho, sāriputta, aṭṭha parisā.

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
gahapatimahāsala

masc. very wealthy householder ✗
gahapatimahāsāla

masc. wealthy householder; rich businessman; lit. householder with a big hall [gahapati + mahāsāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wealthy householder; rich businessman; lit. householder with a big hall
Construction gahapati + mahāsāla
Compound kammadhāraya (gahapati + mahāsāla)
Commentary (SNa) yesaṃ gahapatīnaṃ cattālīsakoṭidhanaṃ nihitaṃ hoti, kahāpaṇakumbho valañjan'atthāya gehamajjhe rāsiṃ katvā ṭhapito hoti, te gahapatimahāsālā nāma.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + mahāśāla

Examples

ye'pi te, mahārāja, gahapatimahāsālā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā, tesam'pi jātānaṃ n'atthi aññatra jarāmaraṇā.

SN 3.3 jarāmaraṇasuttaṃ

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ
gahapatimahāsālakula

nt. very wealthy householder family [gahapati + mahāsāla + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning very wealthy householder family
Construction gahapati + mahāsāla + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (gahapatimahāsāla + kula)
Sanskrit gṛhapati + mahāśāla + kula

Example

idh'ānanda, ekacco ucce kule paccājāto hoti, khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā, aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 450
gahādigaṇa

masc. (gram) √gah etc. group; group 6 roots which take the conjugational sign ppa and ṇhā [gaha + ādi + gaṇa] ✓

Sanskrit grah + ādi + gaṇa

Example

gaṇato te aṭṭhavidhā bhū'v'ādigaṇo rudh'ādigaṇo div'ādigaṇo sv'ādigaṇo kiy'ādigaṇo gah'ādigaṇo tan'ādigaṇo cur'ādigaṇo cā'ti.

saddanīti padamālā savikaraṇākhyātavibhāga
gahāpita

pp. caused to take [√gah + *āpe + ita] ~

Grammar pp of gāhāpeti, caus
Meaning caused to take
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 *āpe (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + *āpe > gāhāpe > gahāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction gahāpe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit grāhita
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
gahāyanta

prp. (+acc) picking up; grabbing hold (of); grasping [√gah + ṇhā + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning picking up; grabbing hold (of); grasping
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahāya (irreg)
Construction gahāya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym pamuñcanta
Sanskrit grāhayat
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
gahita 1

pp. got; grasped; grabbed; held; seized; captured; taken [√gah + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of gaṇhāti
Meaning got; grasped; grabbed; held; seized; captured; taken
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym atta, ādinna, gahīta, gāhita, viggahita
Sanskrit gṛbhita, gṛhīta
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, anattham'pi gahetvā, attho me gahito'ti maññati, attham'pi gahetvā, anattho me gahito'ti maññati.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena candimā devaputto rāhunā asurindena gahito hoti. atha kho candimā devaputto bhagavantaṃ anussaramāno tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

gahitatta

Grammar nt, abstr, from gahita (+gen)

Commentary (SNa) gahītanāvan'ti niggahitanāvaṃ.
gahetabba 1

ptp. (gram) should be employed; should be used; should be adopted; lit. to be taken [√gah + ṇhā + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of gaṇhāti
Meaning (gram) should be employed; should be used; should be adopted; lit. to be taken
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction gahe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Synonym yojetabba, voharitabba
Sanskrit grahītavya
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

sabbesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ paṭhamamajjhim'uttamapurisānaṃ ek'ābhidhāne paro puriso gahetabbo. so ca paṭhati, tvañ'ca paṭhasi, tumhe paṭhatha. so ca pacati, tvañ'ca pacasi. tumhe pacatha. evaṃ sesāsu vibhattīsu paro puriso yojetabbo.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 409

gahetar

masc. who takes hold of; who grasps; who mentions ✗
gahetuṃ 1

inf. (+acc) to understand; to grasp [√gah + ṇhā + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to understand; to grasp
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction gahe + tuṃ
Synonym sammasituṃ
Sanskrit grahītum
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

gahetuṃ 3

inf. (+acc) to believe in [√gah] ✗
gahetvā 1

abs. (+acc) having taken; having grabbed hold (of); having seized [√gah + ṇhā + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having taken; having grabbed hold (of); having seized
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction gahe + tvā
Synonym gaṇhitvā
Sanskrit gṛhītvā́, gṛbhītvā́
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

VIN PAT PA 2 adinnādāna sikkhāpada

APA 421 patthodanadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
gahetvāna 2

abs. (+acc) having included; having taken together [√gah] ✗
gahessati

Grammar fut of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will grab; will seize
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah

Sanskrit grahīṣyati
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi ... na manussaggāho gahessati, na amanussaggāho gahessati, na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ

yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi,
pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi,
upasanto carissasi.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
gahvaratīriyattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 31 (TH31) ✗
gaḷa

adj. dripping; oozing [√gal + a] ~

Root Family √gal
Root √gal･1 a (drip, flow)
Construction √gal > gaḷ + a

Phonetic Change l > ḷ
Synonym pagghariṇī, paggharī, sandana
Variant gala
Sanskrit gala
Sanskrit Root √gal 1 (drop)
gaḷagaḷa

ind. thundering sound ~

Grammar ind, onom
Meaning thundering sound
gaḷagaḷāyati

pr. thunders; lit. makes a gaḷagaḷa sound [gaḷagaḷa + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, onom, deno of gaḷagalā, intrans
Meaning thunders; lit. makes a gaḷagaḷa sound
Construction gaḷagaḷa + āya + ti

Example

devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.

TH 155 sambulakaccānattheragāthā
gaḷagaḷāyanta

prp. thundering; lit. making a gaḷagaḷa sound [gaḷagaḷa + āya + nta] ✓

Meaning thundering; lit. making a gaḷagaḷa sound
Construction gaḷagaḷa + āya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)

Example

idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā

gaḷagaḷāyi

MN 86 aṅgulimālasuttaṃ

atha kho, pāpima, āyasmā vidhuro bhinnena sīsena lohitena gaḷantena kakusandhaṃ'y'eva bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.

Grammar fem, from gāyati
Meaning verse; poem; stanza; lit. song
Root Family √gā

Derivative kita (thā)

Examples

sahassam'api ce gāthā,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthāpadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

DHP 101 sahassavaggo

atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
gāthā 2

fem. suttas comprised of verse; one of the nine kinds of suttas; lit. song [√gā + thā] ✓

Grammar fem, from gāyati
Meaning suttas comprised of verse; one of the nine kinds of suttas; lit. song
Root Family √gā
Root √gā･3 ya (sing)
Construction √gā + thā
Derivative kita (thā)
Commentary (MNa) dhammapadaṃ, theragāthā, therigāthā, suttanipāte nosuttanāmikā suddhikagāthā ca gāthā'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit gāthā
Sanskrit Root √gai √gā 4 (sing)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
gāthā 3

gāthācimā

idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

SN 1.40 dutiyapajjunnadhītusuttaṃ
gāthādvaya

nt. pair of verses [gāthā + dvaya] ~

Meaning pair of verses
Construction gāthā + dvaya

gāthānamāsaya

masc. home of verses; abode of poetry; (comm) support for poetry [gāthānaṃ + āsaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning home of verses; abode of poetry; (comm) support for poetry
Construction gāthānaṃ + āsaya
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāthānaṃ + āsaya)
Commentary (SNa) āsayo'ti patiṭṭhā. kavito hi gāthā pavattanti. so tāsaṃ patiṭṭhā hotī'ti.
Sanskrit gāthānām + āśraya

Examples

kiṃsu nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
kiṃsu tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
kiṃsu sannissitā gāthā,
kiṃsu gāthānam'āsayo'ti.

SN 1.60 kavisuttaṃ

chando nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
akkharā tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
nāmasannissitā gāthā,
kavi gāthānam'āsayo'ti.

DHP 101 sahassavaggo

adj. chanted over with verses; recited over [gāthā + abhigīta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning chanted over with verses; recited over
Construction gāthā + abhigīta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gāthāya + abhigīta)
Sanskrit gāthā + abhigīta

Examples

gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

sattadhā me phale muddhā,
jīvanto na sukhaṃ labhe,
buddhagāth'ābhigīto'mhi,
no ce muñceyya candiman'ti.

SN 2.9 candimasuttaṃ
gāthāya ajjhabhāsi

idiom. addressed in verse; spoke this poem; lit. addressed with verse ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pr
Meaning addressed in verse; spoke this poem; lit. addressed with verse
Sanskrit gāthayā + abhibhāṣ

Example

atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
gādha 1

nt. (+loc) foothold (in); footing (in); ground for standing on (in) [√gādh + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from gādhati (+loc)
Meaning foothold (in); footing (in); ground for standing on (in)
Root Family √gādh
Root √gādh･1 a (stand firmly)
Construction √gādh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNa) gādhan'ti patiṭṭhaṃ
Sanskrit gādha
Sanskrit Root √gādh √gāh 1 (stand firmly)

Example

n'atthi kiccaṃ brāhmaṇassa,
katakicco hi brāhmaṇo,
yāva na gādhaṃ labhati nadīsu,
āyūhati sabbagattebhi jantu,
gādhañ'ca laddhāna thale ṭhito yo,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'va.

SN 2.5 dāmalisuttaṃ
gādha 2

adj. deep [√gādh] ✗
gādhati

pr. finds a footing; stands firmly; is well grounded; finds a support [√gādh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning finds a footing; stands firmly; is well grounded; finds a support
Root Family √gādh
Root √gādh･1 a (stand firmly)
Base √gādh + a > gādha
Construction gādha + ti
Commentary (SNa) gādhatī'ti na patiṭṭhāti.
Sanskrit gādhate
Sanskrit Root √gādh √gāh 1 (stand firmly)

Examples

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti.

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā. ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
gādhamedhati

pr. gets a foothold; finds a footing [gādhaṃ + edhati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning gets a foothold; finds a footing
Construction gādhaṃ + edhati
Commentary (SNa) gādham'edhatī'ti udakaṃ otaraṇakāle gambhīre udake patiṭṭhaṃ labhati.
gādhamesati

pr. seeks a foothold; looks for a footing [gādhaṃ + esati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning seeks a foothold; looks for a footing
Construction gādhaṃ + esati
Commentary (SNa) selaṃ'va siras'ūhacca, pātāle gādham'esathā'ti mahantaṃ kūṭ'āgārappamāṇaṃ silaṃ sīse ṭhapetvā pātāle patiṭṭhagavesanaṃ viya.
gādhi

aor. stood fast, had a firm footing [√gādh] ✗
gāna

nt. singing, song ✗
gāma 1

masc. village; hamlet; lit. collection ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning village; hamlet; lit. collection
Sanskrit grāma

Examples

yathā'pi bhamaro pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇagandham'aheṭhayaṃ,
paleti rasam'ādāya,
evaṃ gāme munī care.

DHP 49 pupphavaggo

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā
gāma 2

masc. group; class; type; family; lit. collection ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning group; class; type; family; lit. collection
Synonym jāta, nikāya
Sanskrit grāma

Examples

so bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā paṭivirato hoti

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
gāma 3

adj. vulgar; common; crude; lit. related to village ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning vulgar; common; crude; lit. related to village
Synonym gamma, pākata, pothujjana
Sanskrit grāma

Example

abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī ahosiṃ ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
gāmaūpacāra

masc. environs; outskirts of a village ✗
gāmaka

masc. small village; hamlet [gāma + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, dimin of gāma
Meaning small village; hamlet
Construction gāma + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit grāmaka

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando vesāliyaṃ viharati beluvagāmake. tena kho pana samayena dasamo gahapati aṭṭhakanāgaro pāṭaliputtaṃ anuppatto hoti kenaci'd'eva karaṇīyena.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
gāmakathā 1

fem. talk about villages [gāma + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about villages
Construction gāma + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāmānaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit grāma + kathā

Example

gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ nagarakathaṃ janapadakathaṃ itthikathaṃ sūrakathaṃ visikhākathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṃ pubbapetakathaṃ nānattakathaṃ

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
gāmakathā 2

fem. village gossip; street talk [gāma + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning village gossip; street talk
Construction gāma + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (gāma + kathā)
Commentary (SNPa) gāmakathāya āvaraye sotan'ti tiracchānakathāto sotaṃ āvareyya.
Sanskrit grāma + kathā

Example

cakkhūhi n'eva lol'assa,
gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
gāmakamma

nt. village work; village affairs ✗
gāmakāvāsa

masc. village monastery [gāmaka + āvāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning village monastery
Construction gāmaka + āvāsa
Commentary (PYt) gāmak'āvāsan'ti gāmo'y'eva khuddakaṭṭhena gāmako, tasmiṃ kārito āvāso gāmak'āvāso, taṃ.
gāmakūṭa

masc. corrupt village magistrate; crooked judge [gāma + kūṭa] ~

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning corrupt village magistrate; crooked judge
Construction gāma + kūṭa
Synonym gāmakūṭaka
Commentary (VINa) gāmakūṭo'ti vinicchay'āmacco.
gāmakūṭaka

masc. corrupt village magistrate; crooked judge [gāma + kūṭaka] ~

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning corrupt village magistrate; crooked judge
Construction gāma + kūṭaka
Compound kammadhāraya (gāma + kūṭaka)
Synonym gāmakūṭa
Commentary (SNa) gāmakūṭako'ti vinicchay'āmacco.
gāmakkhetta

nt. village area; local district; lit. village and field [gāma + khetta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning village area; local district; lit. village and field
Construction gāma + khetta
Commentary (ANa) dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettānī'ti ettha māgadhikaṃ gāmakkhettaṃ atthi khuddakaṃ, atthi majjhimaṃ, atthi mahantaṃ. khuddakaṃ gāmakkhettaṃ ito cattālīsaṃ usabhāni, ito cattālīsan'ti gāvutaṃ hoti, majjhimaṃ ito gāvutaṃ, ito gāvutan'ti aḍḍhayojanaṃ hoti, mahantaṃ ito diyaḍḍhagāvutaṃ, ito diyaḍḍhagāvutan'ti tigāvutaṃ hoti. tesu khuddakena gāmakkhettena tīṇi, khuddakena ca majjhimena ca dve gāmakkhettāni tassa attabhāvo. tigāvutañ'hi'ssa sarīraṃ.
Sanskrit grāma + kṣetra
gāmakhetta

nt. village area; local district ✗
gāmagata 1

adj. gone to a village [gāma + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to a village
Construction gāma + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gāmaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit grāma + gata

Examples

evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, goṇo kiṭṭh'ādo gāmagato vā araññagato vā, ṭhānabahulo vā assa nisajjabahulo vā na taṃ kiṭṭhaṃ puna otareyya, tam'eva purimaṃ daṇḍasamphassaṃ samanussaranto.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti. taṃ kaṇṭako'ti iti viditvā saṃvaro ca asaṃvaro ca veditabbo.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
gāmagata 2

adj. in the village [gāma + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in the village
Construction gāma + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gāmaṃ + gata)
Commentary (MNa) gāmagataṃ vā'ti antogāme vā ṭhapitaṃ.
Sanskrit grāma + gata

Example

adinn'ādāyī hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ gāmagataṃ vā araññagataṃ vā taṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādātā hoti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
gāmagāmaṇika

masc. village chief; local headman [gāma + gāmaṇika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning village chief; local headman
Construction gāma + gāmaṇika
Commentary (ANa) gāmagāmaṇikassā'ti gāmānaṃ gāmaṇikassa, gāmasāmikassā'ti attho. (ANa) gāmagāmaṇiko'ti gāmabhojako.
gāmagāmika

masc. village headman ✗
gāmaghāta 1

masc. sacking or plundering of a village ✗
gāmaghāta 2

masc. village raider; village looter; village plunderer ✗
gāmaghātaka

masc. plunderer of villages; village pillager [gāma + ghātaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning plunderer of villages; village pillager
Construction gāma + ghātaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāmānaṃ + ghātaka)
Commentary (SNa) corā gāmaghātakā'ti yadev'ettha labhissāma, taṃ gaṇhissāma vā ghātessāma vā'ti āgatā cha gāmaghātakacorā.
Sanskrit grāmaghātaka

Example

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, idāni, ambho purisa, imaṃ suññaṃ gāmaṃ corā gāmaghātakā pavisanti. yaṃ te, ambho purisa, karaṇīyaṃ taṃ karohī'ti.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ
gāmajana

masc. people of a village ✗
gāmajeṭṭha

masc. village headman ✗

adj. in a village; lit. standing in a village [gāma + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp

Construction gāma + ṭha

Example

gāmaṭṭhaṃ nāma bhaṇḍaṃ gāme catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti, bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
gāmaṇi

masc. chief; chieftain; headman; leader [gāma + aṇi] ✓

Grammar masc, from gāma
Meaning chief; chieftain; headman; leader
Construction gāma + aṇi
Derivative taddhita (aṇi)
Synonym gāmaṇika, seṭṭha
Commentary (NPa) gāme jeṭṭhakatāya gāmaṇī. (APt) gāmaṃ netī'ti gāmaṇi
Sanskrit grāmaṇī

Examples

suddhaṃ dhammasamuppādaṃ,
suddhaṃ saṅkhārasantatiṃ,
passantassa yathābhūtaṃ,
na bhayaṃ hoti gāmaṇi.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

tena kho pana samayena maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti. atha kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi taṃ parisaṃ etadavoca, mā ayyā evaṃ avacuttha.

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ
gāmaṇika

masc. chief; chieftain; headman; leader [gāma + aṇi + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from gāmaṇi
Meaning chief; chieftain; headman; leader
Construction gāma + aṇi + ka
gāmaṇi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym gāmaṇi, seṭṭha
Sanskrit grāmaṇī + ka

Example

dupposaṃ katvā attānaṃ,
gāme gāmaṇikā viya,
bhutvā bhutvā nipajjanti,
par'āgāresu mucchitā.

SN 2.25 jantusuttaṃ
gāmaṇicandajātaka

nt. Jātaka 257 (JA 257) ✗
gāmaṇijātaka

nt. Jātaka 8 (JA 8) ✗
gāmaṇivagga

masc. Saṃyutta Nikāya 42.1-13 (SN42.1-13) ✗
gāmaṇisaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 42 (SN42) ✗
gāmaṇī

masc. head of a village [gāma] ✗
gāmaṇḍala 1.1

nt. cow in a pit (walking in circles); pitbull; (comm) village boy; lit. cow circle [go + maṇḍala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cow in a pit (walking in circles); pitbull; (comm) village boy; lit. cow circle
Construction go + maṇḍala
Compound kammadhāraya (go + maṇḍala)
Sanskrit gomaṇḍala

Example

catubbipallāsavasaṃ adhiṭṭhitaṃ,
gāmaṇḍalaṃ'va parinesi citta maṃ,
nanu saṃyojanabandhanacchidaṃ,
saṃsevase kāruṇikaṃ mahāmuniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
gāmaṇḍala 2.1

masc. village boys; (comm) young herd boys [gāma + ??] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning village boys; (comm) young herd boys
Construction gāma + ??
Variant gomaṇḍala
Commentary (MNa) gāmaṇḍalā'ti gopāladārakā.
Notes circles of boys from the village?
Sanskrit grāma + maṇḍala

Example

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, susāne seyyaṃ kappemi chav'aṭṭhikāni upadhāya. apissu maṃ, sāriputta, gāmaṇḍalā upasaṅkamitvā oṭṭhubhanti'pi, omuttenti'pi, paṃsukena'pi okiranti, kaṇṇasotesu'pi salākaṃ pavesenti.

Construction gāmaṇḍala + rūpa
Commentary (MNa) gāmaṇḍalarūpo viyā'ti gāmadārakarūpo viya.
gāmato

masc. from the village [gāma + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of gāma
Meaning from the village
Construction gāma + to
Sanskrit grāmāt

Examples

idha, bhante, amhākaṃ yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanāni paññapeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, avakkārapātiṃ upaṭṭhāpeti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

tato ratyā vivasāne,
gām'antam'abhihāraye,
avhānaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
abhihārañ'ca gāmato.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
gāmanigama

masc. village and town [gāma + nigama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning village and town
Construction gāma + nigama
Compound dvanda (gāma ca nigama ca)
Sanskrit grāma + nigama

Example

kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? tattha yaṃ jaññā gāmanigamaṃ, imaṃ kho me gāmanigamaṃ sevato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyantī'ti, evarūpo gāmanigamo na sevitabbo.

nivatth'avatthen'eva gehato nikkhamitvā paramasallekhavuttiko'pi abalabalo amandamando viya paresaṃ acittakarūpena hīḷitaparibhūto hutvā gāmanigamarājadhānīsu ekarattivāsen'eva vicarati.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, hatthidamako mahantaṃ thambhaṃ pathaviyaṃ nikhaṇitvā āraññakassa nāgassa gīvāyaṃ upanibandhati āraññakānañ'c'eva sīlānaṃ abhinimmadanāya ... gām'ante abhiramāpanāya manussakantesu sīlesu samādapanāya.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
gāmantaka

nt. neighbourhood of a village; village ✗
gāmantanāyaka

masc. guide to the village; local guide [gāma + anta + nāyaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning guide to the village; local guide
Construction gāma + anta + nāyaka
Compound catutthī tappurisa (gāmantassa + nāyaka)
Sanskrit grāmānta + nāyaka

Example

so na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, na labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
gāmantara

nt. space between villages; distance between villages [gāma + antara] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning space between villages; distance between villages
Construction gāma + antara
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāmānaṃ + antara)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.7) antamaso gām'antaram'pī'ti kukkuṭasampāte gāme (VINa) kukkuṭasampāde'ti ettha yasmā gāmā nikkhamitvā kukkuṭo padasāva aññaṃ gāmaṃ gacchati, ayaṃ kukkuṭasampādo'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit grāmāntara

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 27 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi, pācittiyaṃ.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living within a village area; staying in the vicinity of a village
Construction gāmanta + vihārī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gāmante + vihārī)
Commentary (ANa) gām'antavihārin'ti gām'antasen'āsanavāsiṃ.
Sanskrit grāmānta + vihārin

Example

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā pahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti gām'antavihārī nemantaniko gahapaticīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
gāmantasambhata

adj. collected in the village area; gathered near the village [gāmanta + sambhata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning collected in the village area; gathered near the village
Construction gāmanta + sambhata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gāmante + sambhata)
Commentary (MNa) gām'antasambhatesū'ti gāmantaṃ āhaṭesu.
Sanskrit grāmānta + sambhṛta

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse sabbasassesu gām'antasambhatesu gopālako gāvo rakkheyya, tassa rukkhamūlagatassa vā abbhokāsagatassa vā satikaraṇīyam'eva hoti, etā gāvo'ti.

VIN 4.5.147 soṇakoḷivisa vatthu
gāmika 2.1

adj. going; leading to [√gam] ✗

Meaning going (to); leading (to)

Construction √gam > gām + *ī + inī
gāmī + inī
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit gāmin
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.

DHP 75 bālavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya, sammādukkhakkhayagāminiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, paññ'indriyaṃ

Examples

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso

diṭṭh'eva dhamme gārayhā,
samparāye ca duggati,
na ne jāti nivāreti,
duggatyā garahāya vā.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchati

idiom. deserves blame; gives grounds for criticism; lit. arrives at a blameworthy position ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + nt + pr
Meaning deserves blame; gives grounds for criticism; lit. arrives at a blameworthy position

Examples

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

kacc'āhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ byākaramāno vuttavādī c'eva bhagavato homi, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi, dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākaromi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī'ti?

Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

Example

yaṃnūna mayaṃ imaṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ mahatīhi daṇḍavākarāhi samantā sappadesaṃ anuparivāreyyāma, app'eva nāma tatiyānaṃ migajātānaṃ āsayaṃ passeyyāma, yattha te gāhaṃ gaccheyyun'ti.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
gāhaka 1

masc. carrier; bearer; holder [√gah + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from gaṇhāti
Meaning carrier; bearer; holder
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah > gāh + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym hāraka
Sanskrit grāhaka
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

anekasākhañ'ca sahassamaṇḍalaṃ,
chattaṃ marū dhārayum'antalikkhe,
suvaṇṇadaṇḍā vītipatanti cāmarā,
na dissare cāmarachattagāhakā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

Synonym paṭiggāhaka

gāhana

nt. submersion, plunging [√gāh] ✗
gāhayati

pr. (+acc) seizes (on); grabs hold (of); lit. causes to grab [√gah + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of gaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning seizes (on); grabs hold (of); lit. causes to grab
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 *aya (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + *aya > gāhaya (caus)
Construction gāhaya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym gaṇhati, gaṇhāti, gheppati
Variant bhāsayati
Sanskrit grāhayati
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

upārambhaṃ na sikkheyya,
khalitañ'ca na gāhaye,
n'ābhihare n'ābhimadde,
na vācaṃ payutaṃ bhaṇe.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
gāhāpaka

masc. confiscator; seizer; lit. who causes to take [√gah + *āpe + aka] ~

Base √gah + *āpe > gāhāpe (caus)
Construction gāhāpe + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

VIN 1.4.2.8 rūpiyasikkhāpadaṃ

Examples

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

tesu ariyasāvakānaṃ dve'y'eva kiccāni ahesuṃ. purebhattaṃ dānaṃ denti, pacchābhattaṃ gandhamāl'ādihatthā vatthabhesajjapānak'ādīni gāhāpetvā dhammassavan'atthāya gacchanti.

gāhāpenta

Synonym gāha

Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato hoti.

gāḷha 1

adj. thick; dense; lit. immersed [√gāh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of gāhati
Meaning thick; dense; lit. immersed

Root √gāh･1 a (dive, plunge)

Synonym appita, gahana, tibba, bahala, sanda
Sanskrit gāḍha
Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gijjho vā kaṅko vā kulalo vā maṃsapesiṃ ādāya uḍḍīyeyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
gijjhakūṭa

masc. name of a mountain peak around Rājagaha; lit. vulture’s peak [gijjha + kūṭa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a mountain peak around Rājagaha; lit. vulture’s peak
Construction gijjha + kūṭa
Compound kammadhāraya (gijjha + kūṭa)
Commentary (ANa) gijjhakūṭe'ti gijjhā tassa kūṭesu vasiṃsu, gijjhasadisaṃ vā tassa kūṭaṃ atthī'ti gijjhakūṭo, tasmiṃ gijjhakūṭe.
Sanskrit gṛdhra + kūṭa

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahācundo āyasmā ca channo gijjhakūṭe pabbate viharanti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

divāvihārā nikkhamma,
gijjhakūṭamhi pabbate,
nāgaṃ ogāhamuttiṇṇaṃ,
nadītīramhi addasaṃ.

Examples

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ assādeti nikāmeti, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu giddho papatāya anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkh'ūpanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
giddhi

fem. greed; desire [√gidh + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from gijjhati
Meaning greed; desire
Root Family √gidh
Root √gidh･3 ya (be greedy)
Construction √gidh + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym jappā
Sanskrit gṛddhi (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

Example

agiddhilobhaṃ nissāya giddhilobho pahātabbo. anindārosaṃ nissāya nindāroso pahātabbo. akkodh'ūpāyāsaṃ nissāya kodh'ūpāyāso pahātabbo. anatimānaṃ nissāya atimāno pahātabbo.

giddhimāna

masc. greed and pride ✗

Meaning dependent on greed and covetousness; due to intense desire
Construction giddhi + lobha + paccaya + ā
giddhilobhapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit gṛddhi (bsk) + lobha + pratyayāt

Example

ahañ'c'eva kho pana giddhilobhī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya giddhilobhapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ giddhilobhapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā giddhilobhapaccayā.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
giddhilobhī

adj. greedy and covetous; intensely desiring [giddhi + lobha + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from giddhilobha
Meaning greedy and covetous; intensely desiring
Construction giddhi + lobha + ī
giddhilobha + ī

Example

ahañ'c'eva kho pana giddhilobhī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya giddhilobhapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ giddhilobhapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā giddhilobhapaccayā.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
giddhī

adj. (+loc) having desire (for); wanting; longing (for) [√gidh + ti + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from giddhi (+loc)
Meaning having desire (for); wanting; longing (for)
Root Family √gidh
Root √gidh･3 ya (be greedy)
Construction √gidh + ti + ī
giddhi + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym apekkha
Commentary (SNa) vacchagiddhiniyo'ti vacchesu sasnehā thanehi khīraṃ paggharantehi vacchakasnehena sayam'eva gamissantī'ti.
Sanskrit gṛddhi (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

Example

tena hi tvaṃ, nanda, sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātehī'ti. gamissanti, bhante, gāvo vacchagiddhiniyo'ti. niyyāteh'eva tvaṃ, nanda, sāmikānaṃ gāvo'ti.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
gini

masc. fire; fireplace [√agg + i] ✓

Grammar masc, from aggi
Meaning fire; fireplace
Root Family √agg
Root √agg×1 a (move crookedly)
Construction √agg + i > gini
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change agni > gini (aphesis)
Sanskrit agni
Sanskrit Root √ag 1 (move tortuously)

Examples

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2

akkodhano vigatakhilo'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiy'ekarattivāso,
vivaṭā kuṭi nibbuto gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
gimha

masc. heat; warmth ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning heat; warmth
Synonym tāpa
Sanskrit grīṣma

Example

vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
gimhakāla

masc. hot season; summer; lit. hot time [gimha + kāla] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hot season; summer; lit. hot time
Construction gimha + kāla
Synonym gimhā, gimhāna, gimhi, gimhotu
gimhā

masc. hot season; summer; lit. hot months [gimha + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl of gimha
Meaning hot season; summer; lit. hot months
Construction gimha + ā
Synonym gimhakāla, gimhāna, gimhi, gimhotu
Sanskrit grīṣma

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

māso seso gimhānan'ti, bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ, addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 24 vassikasāṭikasikkhāpadaṃ
gimhāna

nt. hot season; summer; lit. of the hot [gimha + ā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from gimha
Meaning hot season; summer; lit. of the hot
Construction gimha + ā + ana
Derivative taddhita (ana)
Synonym gimhakāla, gimhā, gimhi
Notes wrong derivation of gen pl of gimhā. gimhānaṃ > gimhāna
Sanskrit grīṣma

Example

addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbanti. addhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāsetabbaṃ

VIN 1.4.3.4 vassikasāṭikasikkhāpadaṃ
gimhānamāsa

masc. hot month; hottest month; lit. month of heat [gimhānaṃ + māsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hot month; hottest month; lit. month of heat
Construction gimhānaṃ + māsa
Compound alutta catutthī tappurisa (gimhānaṃ + māsa)
Sanskrit grīṣma + māsa

Example

vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
gimhānaṃ pacchime māse

idiom. in the last month of the hot season ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + adj + masc
Meaning in the last month of the hot season
Sanskrit grīṣma + paścima + māsa

Examples

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse tālavaṇṭena'pi vidhūpanena'pi vātaṃ pariyesanti, ossavane'pi tiṇāni na icchanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ṭhite majjh'anhike kāle marīcikā phandati.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
gimhi

masc. hot season; summer [gimha + i] ✓

Grammar masc, from gimha
Meaning hot season; summer
Construction gimha + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Synonym gimhakāla, gimhā, gimhāna, gimhotu
Sanskrit grīṣmī

Example

idha vassaṃ vasissāmi,
idha hem'antagimhisu,
iti bālo vicinteti,
antarāyaṃ na bujjhati.

DHP 286 maggavaggo
gimhika

adj. hot; for the summer; related to the summer season [gimha + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from gimha
Meaning hot; for the summer; related to the summer season
Construction gimha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit grīṣma +

Examples

atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi

DN 14.4 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ yaso nāma kulaputto seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti. tassa tayo pāsādā honti, eko hem'antiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.

VIN 4.1.7 pabbajjākathā
gimhotu

masc. summer; hot season [gimha + utu] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning summer; hot season
Construction gimha + utu
Synonym gimhakāla, gimhā, gimhi

Example

ayaṃ gimho'tu, asmiñ'ca utumhi aṭṭha uposathā, iminā pakkhena: eko uposatho sampatto, eko uposathā atikkantā, cha uposathā avasiṭṭhā.

PAT PK dhammayuttika-pubbakicca
giragga

nt. mountain-top; peak of a mountain [giri + agga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mountain-top; peak of a mountain
Construction giri + agga
Commentary (PYt) girissa vā'tiādinā girissa aggo koṭi giraggo
giraggasamajja

masc. mountain-top festival [giragga + samajja] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mountain-top festival
Construction giragga + samajja
Commentary (VINa) gir'aggasamajjo'ti girimhi aggasamajjo, girissa vā aggadese samajjo. (PYt) imehi padehi aggo samajjo aggasamajjo, girimhi pavatto aggasamajjo gir'aggasamajjo'ti atthaṃ dasseti. samajjo'ti ca sabhā. sā hi samāgamaṃ ajanti gacchanti janā etthā'ti samajjo'ti vuccati. girissa vā'tiādinā girissa aggo koṭi gir'aggo, tasmiṃ pavatto samajjo gir'aggasamajjo'ti attho dassito.
girā

fem. speech [√gir + ā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning speech
Root Family √gir
Root √gir･1 a (call, speak)
Construction √gir + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit gira
Sanskrit Root √gṝ 9 (call, invoke)

Examples

akakkasaṃ viññāpaniṃ,
giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 408 brāhmaṇavaggo

sampajānamusāvādo nāma visaṃvādanapurekkhārassa vācā, girā, byappatho, vacībhedo, vācasikā viññatti, aṭṭha anariyavohārā, adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me'ti, assutaṃ sutaṃ me'ti

giri

anuddhato acapalo,
nipako saṃvut'indriyo,
sobhati paṃsukūlena,
sīho'va girigabbhare.

giriaggasamajja

saṃcintaye taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

masc. name of a monk; lit. happy mountain [giriṃ + ānanda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; lit. happy mountain
Construction giriṃ + ānanda
Commentary (THa) so tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde rājagahe bimbisārarañño purohitassa putto hutvā nibbatti, girimānando'ti'ssa nāmaṃ ahosi.
Sanskrit girim + ānanda

Example

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
gila

pp. swallowed, devoured, eaten [√gil] ✗
gilati

pr. (+acc) swallows; devours; eats [√gil + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning swallows; devours; eats
Root Family √gil
Root √gil･1 a (eat, swallow)
Base √gil + a > gila
Construction gila + ti
Synonym khādati
Sanskrit girati
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

Example

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
gilana

nt. swallowing [√gil] ✗
gilanta

prp. swallowing, devouring [√gil] ✗
gilabaḷisa

adj. swallowing the hook, who has swallowed the hook ✗
gilāna 1

adj. sick; ill; unwell; lit. being sick [√gilā + ana] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning sick; ill; unwell; lit. being sick
Root Family √gilā
Root √gilā･3 ya (be sick, tired)
Construction √gilā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym agilāna
Synonym akallaka, ātura, ābādhika, byādhika
Sanskrit glāna
Sanskrit Root √glai √glā 1, 2, 4 (be weary)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhun'upassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānā hoti bhikkhunī, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 23 bhikkhunupassayasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno

Meaning sick person; patient; lit. being sick

āgantukassa dānaṃ deti, gamikassa dānaṃ deti, gilānassa dānaṃ deti, dubbhikkhe dānaṃ deti, yāni tāni navasassāni navaphalāni tāni paṭhamaṃ sīlavantesu patiṭṭhāpeti.

Meaning sickness; illness; lit. being sick

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ
gilānaka 1

masc. who is sick; unwell person; ill person [√gilā + na + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from gilāna
Meaning who is sick; unwell person; ill person
Root Family √gilā
Root √gilā･3 ya (be sick, tired)
Construction √gilā + na + ka
gilāna + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit glānaka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √glai √glā 1, 2, 4 (be weary)

Example

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
gilānaka 2

adj. sick, unwell [√gilā] ✗
gilānagilānupaṭṭhākaāgantukagamika

adj. (what is) is leftover from a sick person's meal ✗
gilānadassana

nt. visiting the sick [gilāna + dassana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning visiting the sick
Construction gilāna + dassana
gilānadassanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 41.10 (SN41.10) ✗
gilānapaccaya

masc. support for the sick; healthcare; lit. support for illness [gilāna + paccaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning support for the sick; healthcare; lit. support for illness
Construction gilāna + paccaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (gilānāya + paccaya)
Variant gilānappaccaya
Commentary (VINa) gilānapaccayo'va bhesajjaṃ gilānapaccayabhesajjaṃ, yaṃkiñci gilānassa sappāyaṃ bhisakkakammaṃ telamadhuphāṇit'ādī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit glānapratyaya

Examples

adhivāsetu no bhante,
gilānapaccayaṃ imaṃ,
anukampaṃ upādāya,
paṭigaṇhātu'm'uttama.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anavasesadohī hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ saddhā gahapatikā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārenti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārehi. tatra bhikkhu mattaṃ na jānāti paṭiggahaṇāya.

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
gilānapaccayabhesajja

nt. healthcare and medicine [gilānapaccaya + bhesajja] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning healthcare and medicine
Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajja
gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra

masc. healthcare and medicinal requisites; support for the sick and medicines [gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning healthcare and medicinal requisites; support for the sick and medicines
Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra
Compound dvanda (gilānapaccaya ca bhesajjaparikkhāra ca)
Variant gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra
Commentary (VISM) gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāran'ti ettha rogassa paṭiayan'aṭṭhena paccayo, paccanīkagaman'aṭṭhenā'ti attho. yassa kassaci sappāyass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. bhisakkassa kammaṃ tena anuññātattā'ti bhesajjaṃ. gilānapaccayo'va bhesajjaṃ gilānapaccayabhesajjaṃ, yaṃkiñci gilānassa sappāyaṃ bhisakkakammaṃ telamadhuphāṇit'ādī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjha-paramatāyā

MN 2.4 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānuppadāna

nt. providing healthcare and medicinal requisites [gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning providing healthcare and medicinal requisites
Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāre + anuppadāna)
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra + anupradāna
gilānapucchaka

adj. who enquires about health of; lit. who enquires about sickness [gilāna + pucchaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who enquires about health of; lit. who enquires about sickness
Construction gilāna + pucchaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gilānaṃ + pucchaka)
Sanskrit glāna + pṛcchaka

Examples

atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahācundo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahācundaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso cunda, yen'āyasmā channo ten'upasaṅkamissāma gilānapucchakā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti. gilānapucchakā bhikkhū gilāne bhikkhū etadavocuṃ, kacc'āvuso, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyan'ti?

yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning invitation for medical requisites; offer of medical support
Construction gilāna + paccaya + pavāraṇā
Compound catutthī tappurisa (gilānappaccayassa + pavāraṇā)
Sanskrit glāna + pratyaya + pravāraṇa

Example

agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā'ti gilānappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā.

VIN 2.5.5.7 mahānāmasikkhāpadaṃ
gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra

masc. healthcare and medicinal requisites [gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning healthcare and medicinal requisites
Construction gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra
Compound dvanda (gilānappaccaya ca bhesajjaparikkhāra ca)
Variant gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra

Examples

yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu

ind. for the sake of healthcare and medicinal requisites [gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of healthcare and medicinal requisites
Construction gilānappaccaya + bhesajja + parikkhāra + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārassa + hetu)
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra + hetu

Examples

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ

na kho pan'āhaṃ cīvarahetu agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito na piṇḍapātahetu ... na sen'āsanahetu ... na gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

MN 17 vanapatthasuttaṃ
gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānuppadāna

nt. providing healthcare and medical requisites [gilānappaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning providing healthcare and medical requisites
Construction gilānappaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna
gilānabhatta

nt. food for the sick [gilāna + bhatta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning food for the sick
Construction gilāna + bhatta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (gilānassa + bhatta)
Sanskrit glāna + bhakta

Example

imaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca gilānabhattaṃ anuññātaṃ gilānabhesajjaṃ anuññātaṃ gilān'upaṭṭhāko anuññāto. imañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca aññe'pi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā.

AN 3.22 gilānasuttaṃ
gilānabhāva

masc. sickness; illness; lit. sickness state [gilāna + bhāva] ~

Construction gilāna + bhāva
Synonym ātaṅka, ābādha, gada, byādhi, roga
Commentary (ANt) gilānassa bhāvo gelaññan'ti āha gilānabhāvato'ti.

gilānasamaya

masc. time of sickness; occasion of illness [gilāna + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of sickness; occasion of illness
Construction gilāna + samaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gilānassa + samaya)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.2) gilānasamayo nāma antamaso pādā'pi phalitā honti. gilānasamayo'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ. (VIN 2.5.6.7) gilānasamayo nāma yassa vinā nahānena na phāsu hoti, gilānasamayo'ti nahāyitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit glāna + samaya

Examples

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 32 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

paramparabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

Sanskrit glāna + śālā

Example

SN 36.7 paṭhamagelaññasuttaṃ

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.121 (AN5.121) ✗
gilānātiritta

nt. leftovers of a sick person [gilāna + atiritta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning leftovers of a sick person
Construction gilāna + atiritta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gilānassa + atiritta)
Commentary (VINa) gilān'ātirittan'ti ettha na kevalaṃ yaṃ gilānassa bhutt'āvasesaṃ hoti, taṃ gilān'ātirittaṃ, atha kho yaṃkiñci gilānaṃ uddissa ajja vā sve vā yadā vā icchati, tadā khādissatī'ti āhaṭaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ gilān'ātirittan'ti veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit glāna + pṛcchaka

Example

bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti, alam'etaṃ sabban'ti avuttaṃ hoti, na gilān'ātirittaṃ hoti, etaṃ anatirittaṃ nāma.

Example

AN 3.22 gilānasuttaṃ
gili

aor. (+acc) swallowed; gulped down [√gil + i] ✓

Grammar aor of gilati, trans (+acc)
Meaning swallowed; gulped down
Root Family √gil
Root √gil･1 a (eat, swallow)
Construction √gil + i
Sanskrit gīryāt
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

Examples

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe ramessu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

DHP 371 bhikkhuvaggo

yo andhakāre tamasi pabhaṅ'karo,
verocano maṇḍalī uggatejo.
mā rāhu gilī caram'antalikkhe,
pajaṃ mamaṃ rāhu pamuñca sūriyan'ti.

SN 2.10 sūriyasuttaṃ
gilita

pp. swallowed; gulped down [√gil + ita] ~

Grammar pp of gilati
Meaning swallowed; gulped down
Root Family √gil
Root √gil･1 a (eat, swallow)
Construction √gil + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit galita, girita, gilita
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

adj. swallowed the hook; taken the bait [gilita + baḷisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning swallowed the hook; taken the bait
Construction gilita + baḷisa
Commentary (NPa) ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilitabaḷiso mārassā'ti ayaṃ, bhikkhu, kilesamārassa baḷisabhūtaṃ rūpataṇhaṃ gilitvā ṭhito'ti vuccati.

gihipaṭisaṃyutta

adj. concerned with laypeople; connected with householders [gihī + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

gihipaṭissava

masc. verbal agreement; oral contract; lit. layperson's promise [gihī + paṭissava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning verbal agreement; oral contract; lit. layperson's promise
Construction gihī + paṭissava
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gihino + paṭissava)
Commentary (ANa) dhammikañ'ca gihipaṭissavan'ti imaṃ temāsaṃ idh'eva vasitabban'ti vutto evaṃ hotū'tiādinā nayena paṭissavaṃ.
Sanskrit gṛhin + pratiśrava

Example

gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati, gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammikañ'ca gihipaṭissavaṃ na saccāpeti.

Example

Example

yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇ'avatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan'ti.

Meaning synonym for a householder

Example

gihī

masc. householder; layperson [√gah + a + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from geha
Meaning householder; layperson

Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah > geh > gih + a + ī
geha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change a > i
Synonym gahaṭṭha
Sanskrit gṛhin
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhopannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
gihīpabbajitā

masc. householders and monastics; laypeople and renunciants [gihī + pabbajita + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning householders and monastics; laypeople and renunciants
Construction gihī + pabbajita + ā
gihīpabbajita + ā
Compound dvanda (gihī ca pabbajitā ca)
Sanskrit gṛhin + pravrājita

Example

mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici,
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

nt. fetter that binds a householder ✗
gīta 1

nt. singing; lit. sung [√gā + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of gāyati
Meaning singing; lit. sung
Root Family √gā
Root √gā･3 ya (sing)
Construction √gā > gī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
Sanskrit gīta
Sanskrit Root √gai √gā 4 (sing)

Examples

ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ naccaṃ. komārakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ ativelaṃ dantavidaṃsakahasitaṃ.

AN 3.108 ruṇṇasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

gīta 2

pp. (of verse) recited; quoted; spoken; lit. sung [√gā + ta] ✓

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
Synonym bhāsita
Sanskrit gīta
Sanskrit Root √gai √gā 4 (sing)

Meaning neck

gīvūpaga

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of jewellery) necklace; lit. suitable for neck
Construction gīvā + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gīvaṃ + upaga)
Commentary (VINa) sīs'ūpagan'ti'ādīsu sīsaṃ upagacchatī'ti sīs'ūpagaṃ, potthakesu pana sīs'ūpakan'ti likhitaṃ, yassa kassaci sīs'ālaṅkārass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. esa nayo sabbattha.
Sanskrit grīvā + upaga

Example

nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.

ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
guṇa 4

masc. subdivision; section; category; stage ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning subdivision; section; category; stage
Synonym koṭṭhāsa, pabheda, bhāga

Sanskrit guṇa

Example

accenti kālā tarayanti rattiyo,
vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahanti,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

atha kho so, bhikkhave, mudumūsi gocarāya pakkāmi. tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā saṅkhāditvā ajjhohari. tassa so mudumūsi antam'pi khādi, antaguṇam'pi khādi.

pp. (+loc) guarded; protected; kept watch (over) [√gup + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of gopeti (+loc)
Meaning guarded; protected; kept watch (over)
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 a (guard)
Construction √gup + ta

Phonetic Change p > t

Examples

cittaṃ guttaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 36 cittavaggo

annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosan'atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.

guttadvāra

adj. (+loc) guarding the doors (of); with self-restraint (in); protecting the mind (wrt); lit. guarded doors [gutta + dvāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning guarding the doors (of); with self-restraint (in); protecting the mind (wrt); lit. guarded doors

Antonym aguttadvāra
Sanskrit gupta + dvāra

Examples

indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī n'ānubyañjanaggāhī

tassa na t'ādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
gunnaṃ 2

masc. when cows [go + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, gen abs, gen pl of go, irreg
Meaning when cows
Construction go + ānaṃ
Sanskrit gonām

Example

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

AN 4.70 adhammikasuttaṃ
gumba 1

masc. (of fish) school ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (of fish) school
Sanskrit gulma

Example

najjāyo supatitthāyo,
soṇṇavālukasanthatā,
acchā savanti ambūni,
macchagumbanisevitā.

JA 546 vidhura jātakaṃ
gumba 2

masc. thicket; bush; shrub ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning thicket; bush; shrub
Synonym pagumba
Sanskrit gulma

Example

k'āyaṃ eḷagalāgumbe,
karoti ahuhāsiyaṃ,
na'y'idha naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā,
tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

guyha 1

Grammar ptp of gūhati (+loc)

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā
gulasi

fem. kind of plant ✗
gulā

fem. bird's nest; (comm) female bird [√kul + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, in comps
Meaning bird's nest; (comm) female bird
Root Family √kul
Root √kul･1 a (be close)
Construction √kul > gul + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change k > g
Commentary (ANa) gulā nāma sakuṇikā, tassā kulāvako'ti'pi eke.
Sanskrit kulāya
Sanskrit Root √kul 1 (accumulate)

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
gulāguṇṭhika

nt. bird's nest tangle; (comm) sticky ball of thread [gulā + guṇṭhika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bird's nest tangle; (comm) sticky ball of thread
Construction gulā + guṇṭhika
Commentary (ANa) gulāguṇṭhikaṃ vuccati pesakārakañjiyasuttaṃ.
Sanskrit kulāya + guṇṭhita

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
gulāguṇṭhikajāta

adj. like a tangled bird's nest; (comm) (or) like a sticky ball of thread [gulā + guṇṭhika + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a tangled bird's nest; (comm) (or) like a sticky ball of thread
Construction gulā + guṇṭhika + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (gulāguṇṭhika + jāta)
Variant kulāguṇṭhikajāta
Commentary (ANa) gulāguṇṭhikajāto'ti gulāguṇṭhikaṃ vuccati pesakārakañjiyasuttaṃ. gulā nāma sakuṇikā, tassā kulāvako'ti'pi eke.
Sanskrit kulāya + guṇṭhita + jāta

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

gulissāni

masc. name of a monk ✗
guha

root. (gram) √guh (hide, conceal) [√guh + a] ✓

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 486
guhaṭṭhakasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 4.2 (SNP 40) ✗

Meaning cave; cavern
Root Family √guh

Construction √guh + ā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
guhāgehagata

adj. living in a cave dwelling; lit. gone to cave home [guhā + geha + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in a cave dwelling; lit. gone to cave home
Construction guhā + geha + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (guhāgehaṃ + gata)
Commentary (THa) tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasī'ti tasmiṃ pabbatakānane guhāsaṅkhātaṃ gehaṃ upagato bhāvanāratiyā abhiramissasi.
Sanskrit guhā + geha + gata

Example

varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhasevite,
pabbhārakuṭṭe pakat'eva sundare,
nav'ambunā pāvusasitthakānane,
tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
guhāsaya

adj. hidden in the heart; lit. dwelling in a cave [guha + āsaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning hidden in the heart; lit. dwelling in a cave
Construction guha + āsaya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (guhe + āsaya)
Commentary (DHPa) guhā nāma catumahābhūtaguhā, idañ'ca hadayarūpaṃ nissāya pavattatī'ti guhāsayaṃ nāma jātaṃ.
Sanskrit guhāśaya

Examples

dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ,
asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

DHP 37 cittavaggo

it'āyaṃ kodharūpena,
maccupāso guhāsayo,
taṃ damena samucchinde,
paññāvīriyena diṭṭhiyā.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje labhetha otāran'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

gū 1

masc. who goes; goes after; going; gone; having gone [√gam + ū] ✓

n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
gū 2

masc. skilled in; fulfilled in; complete in; lit. goer [√gam + ū] ✓

Sanskrit gū
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ,
kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
gūtha

masc. excrement; dung; faeces [√gū + tha] ✓

Meaning excrement; dung; faeces

Construction √gū + tha
Derivative kita (tha)
Synonym uccāra
Sanskrit gūtha
Sanskrit Root √gu √gū 6 (void)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, pathaviyā sucim'pi nikkhipanti, asucim'pi nikkhipanti, gūthagatam'pi nikkhipanti, muttagatam'pi nikkhipanti, kheḷagatam'pi nikkhipanti, pubbagatam'pi nikkhipanti, lohitagatam'pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrgūthassaā puṇṇā. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

gūthakaṭāha

masc. pot for defecation ✗

Grammar masc, comp

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, gūthakūpo sādhikaporiso, pūro gūthassa. atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva gūthakūpaṃ paṇidhāya.

gūthakūpapurisaupamā

nt. Petavatthu 43 (PV 43) ✗

gūthakhādasutta

Meaning eating faeces; excrement eater

Meaning gone through excrement; covered in excrement

Sanskrit gūtha + gata

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ahi gūthagato kiñ'c'āpi na daṃsati, atha kho naṃ makkheti.

Meaning kind of excrement
Construction gūtha + gata

Sanskrit gūtha + gata

Example

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, pathaviyā sucim'pi nikkhipanti, asucim'pi nikkhipanti, gūthagatam'pi nikkhipanti, muttagatam'pi nikkhipanti, kheḷagatam'pi nikkhipanti, pubbagatam'pi nikkhipanti, lohitagatam'pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
gūthagandha

masc. smell of excrement; whiff of dung [gūtha + gandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning smell of excrement; whiff of dung
Construction gūtha + gandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gūthassa + gandha)
gūthaṭṭhāna

nt. cesspool; lit. excrement place [gūtha + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cesspool; lit. excrement place
Construction gūtha + ṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (gūtha + ṭhāna)
Synonym oḷigalla
Sanskrit gūtha + sthāna

Example

evañ'ce taṃ jano jaññā,
yathā jānāmi taṃ ahaṃ,
ārakā parivajjeyya,
gūthaṭṭhānaṃ'va pāvuse.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
gūthaniraya

masc. excrement hell ✗
gūthapāṇaka

masc. insect living on excrement ✗
gūthapāṇajātaka

nt. Jātaka 227 (JA 227) ✗
gūthapūra

adj. full of dung; full of excrement; stuffed with faeces [gūtha + pūra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of dung; full of excrement; stuffed with faeces
Construction gūtha + pūra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gūthassa + pūra)
Commentary (SNa) gūthapūrā'ti anto gūthena bharitā.
Sanskrit gūtha + pūra

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
gūthabhakkha

adj. feeding on dung ✗
gūthabhastā

fem. bag of dung ✗
gūthabhāṇī

adj. who lies; lit. excrement talker [gūtha + bhāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who lies; lit. excrement talker
Construction gūtha + bhāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (gūtha + bhāṇī)
Commentary (ANa) gūthabhāṇī'ti yo gūthaṃ viya duggandhakathaṃ katheti.
Sanskrit gūtha + bhāṇin

Example

tayo'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame tayo? gūthabhāṇī, pupphabhāṇī, madhubhāṇī. katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī?

geṇḍu 1

masc. playing ball ✗
geṇḍu 2

masc. tower; turret ✗
geṇḍuka

masc. playing ball ✗
gedha 1.1

masc. (+loc) greed (for); desire (for); yearning (for) [√gidh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gijjhati (+loc)
Meaning greed (for); desire (for); yearning (for)
Root Family √gidh
Root √gidh･3 ya (be greedy)
Construction √gidh > gedh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym adhippāya, lobha
Sanskrit gṛddha
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

Examples

diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
gedha 2.1

Grammar masc
Meaning thicket; thick bush

gedhataṇhā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning greed and craving
Construction gedha + taṇhā
gedhi

fem. greedy, hungry desire; wanting ✗
gedhikata

adj. made greedy; become greedy; longing for ✗
gedhita 1

pp. (+loc) had greed (for); desired (for) [√gidh + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of gijjhati (+loc)
Meaning had greed (for); desired (for)
Root Family √gidh
Root √gidh･3 ya (be greedy)
Construction √gidh > gedh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit gardhita
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

Example

te sāvake upanetvā pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desetvā pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhitacittā pabbajitesu, kāyassa bhedā pāṇ'upacchedā hīne kāye patiṭṭhitā.

nt. (+loc) greed [√gidh] ✗

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
gedhimakāsi

aor. (+loc) desired (for); yearned (for); had desire (for); lit. made greed [gedhaṃ + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor of gedhiṃ karoti, comp vb, intrans (+loc)
Meaning desired (for); yearned (for); had desire (for); lit. made greed
Construction gedhaṃ > gedhiṃ + akāsi
Phonetic Change a > i before √kar
Compound comp verb (gedhiṃ + akāsi)
Sanskrit gṛddhi

Examples

sace kho tvaṃ, mārisa, evaṃ pajānāsi, sace tvaṃ evaṃ anubuddho, mā sāvake upanesi, mā pabbajite, mā sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesi, mā pabbajitānaṃ, mā sāvakesu gedhim'akāsi, mā pabbajitesu.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā paṭijānamānā. te sāvake upanesuṃ pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesuṃ pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhim'akaṃsu pabbajitesu

VIN 2.5.2.9 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
gelañña

nt. sickness; ill health; lit. sick state [√gilā + na + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from gilāna
Meaning sickness; ill health; lit. sick state
Root Family √gilā
Root √gilā･3 ya (be sick, tired)
Construction √gilā > gelā + na + *ya
gilāna + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit glānya, gailānya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √glai √glā 1, 2, 4 (be weary)

Example

ahaṃ kho gilānā vuṭṭhito aciravuṭṭhito gelaññā. tassa me kāyo dubbalo akammañño. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo orabbhiko hoti sūkariko sākuṇiko māgaviko luddo macchaghātako coro coraghātako goghātako bandhan'āgāriko, ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

goghātakantevāsī

Sanskrit goghātaka + antevāsin

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
goghātakasūnā

fem. slaughter-house; butchery; lit. cow killer's chopping block [goghātaka + sūnā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning slaughter-house; butchery; lit. cow killer's chopping block
Construction goghātaka + sūnā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (goghātakassa + sūnā)
Synonym asisūnā, sūnā
Sanskrit goghātaka + sūnā

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, kukkuro jighacchādubbalyapareto goghātakasūnaṃ paccupaṭṭhito assa.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
gocara 1

masc. food; fodder; grazing; pasture; lit. (where the) cows walk [go + cara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning food; fodder; grazing; pasture; lit. (where the) cows walk
Construction go + cara
Compound kammadhāraya (go + cara)
Synonym ghāsa
Sanskrit gocara

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi. siṅgālopi kho, bhikkhave, sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
gocara 2

masc. environment; range; hunting ground; field of activity; domain; suitable place; suitable alms resort; lit. (where the) cows walk [go + cara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning environment; range; hunting ground; field of activity; domain; suitable place; suitable alms resort; lit. (where the) cows walk
Construction go + cara
Compound kammadhāraya (go + cara)
Antonym agocara
Synonym visaya
Sanskrit gocara

Examples

ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ky'āssa byappathayo assu,
ky'āss'assu idha gocarā,
kāni sīlabbatān'āssu,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
gocara 3

masc. sphere; domain; field; lit. (where the) cows walk [go + cara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sphere; domain; field; lit. (where the) cows walk
Construction go + cara
Compound kammadhāraya (go + cara)
Synonym visaya
Sanskrit gocara

Examples

yesaṃ sannicayo n'atthi,
ye pariññātabhojanā,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yesaṃ gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
gati tesaṃ durannayā.

DHP 92 arahantavaggo

yassa jitaṃ n'āvajīyati,
jitaṃ yassa no yāti koci loke,
taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

DHP 179 buddhavaggo
gocara 4

masc. object of the senses; lit. (where the) cows walk [go + cara] ~
