Meaning object of the senses; lit. (where the) cows walk
Construction go + cara
Compound kammadhāraya (go + cara)
Sanskrit gocara
gocarakusala 1

adj. skilled in pastures [gocara + kusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in pastures
Construction gocara + kusala
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gocaresu + kusala)
Commentary (ANa) na gocarakusalo hotī'ti gopālakena hi gocarakusalena bhavitabbaṃ, pañc'āhikacāro vā satt'āhikacāro vā jānitabbo.
Sanskrit gocara + kusala

Example

idha, bhikkhave, gopālako ... na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
gocarakusala 2

adj. skilled in meditation subjects; lit. skilled in pastures [gocara + kusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in meditation subjects; lit. skilled in pastures
Construction gocara + kusala
Compound sattamī tappurisa (gocaresu + kusala)
Commentary (ANa) na gocarakusalo hotī'ti so gopālako pañc'āhikasatt'āhikacāre viya cattāro satipaṭṭhāne, ime lokiyā, ime lok'uttarā'ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
Sanskrit gocara + kusala

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
gocaragāma

masc. alms village; village where alms is obtained; lit. village pasture [gocara + gāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning alms village; village where alms is obtained; lit. village pasture
Construction gocara + gāma
Compound kammadhāraya (gocara + gāma)
Sanskrit gocara + grāma

Examples

tatth'addasaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ bhūmibhāgaṃ, pāsādikañ'ca vanasaṇḍaṃ, nadiñ'ca sandantiṃ setakaṃ supatitthaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ, samantā ca gocaragāmaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

antaraghare nikkhipeyyā'ti samantā gocaragāme nikkhipeyya.

gocaravisaya 1

masc. feeding ground; lit. pasture and environment [gocara + visaya] ✓

Meaning feeding ground; lit. pasture and environment
Construction gocara + visaya
Compound dvanda (gocara ca visaya ca)
Sanskrit gocara + viśaya

Example

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
gocaravisaya 2

masc. range and domain; sense range; sense field [gocara + visaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning range and domain; sense range; sense field
Construction gocara + visaya
Compound dvanda (gocara ca visaya ca)
Commentary (MNa) gocaravisayan'ti gocarabhūtaṃ visayaṃ.
Sanskrit gocara + viśaya

Examples

imesaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ nānāvisayānaṃ nānāgocarānaṃ na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhontānaṃ mano paṭisaraṇaṃ, mano'va nesaṃ gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhotī'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

pañc'imāni, āvuso, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, sot'indriyaṃ, ghān'indriyaṃ, jivh'indriyaṃ, kāy'indriyaṃ.

navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārayamānena dve bhāgā suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ ādātabbā, tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ, catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ.

catutthaṃ gocariyānan'ti tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ.

MN 2.6 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
goṇaka

masc. shag cover; fleece; (comm) long haired black rug ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning shag cover; fleece; (comm) long haired black rug

Commentary (THIa) gonakatūlikasanthatan'ti dīghalomakāḷakojavena c'eva haṃsalom'ādipuṇṇāya tūlikāya ca santhataṃ.
Sanskrit goṇikā (woolen cloth)

Example

sudhotarajapacchadaṃ subhaṃ,
goṇakatūlikasanthataṃ navaṃ,
abhiruha sayanaṃ mah'ārahaṃ,
candanamaṇḍitasāragandhikaṃ.

Sanskrit goṇikā + āstīrṇa

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītipallaṅkasahassāni ahesuṃ dantamayāni sāramayāni sovaṇṇamayāni goṇak'atthatāni paṭik'atthatāni paṭalik'atthatāni kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇāni sauttaracchadāni ubhatolohitak'ūpadhānāni.

laddhā mudhā nibbutiṃ bhuñjamānā,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

ye me pubbe viyākaṃsu,
huraṃ gotamasāsanā,
icc'āsi iti bhavissati,
sabbaṃ taṃ itih'ītihaṃ,
sabbaṃ taṃ takkavaḍḍhanaṃ,
n'āhaṃ tattha abhiramiṃ.

masc. Chapter 6 of Aṭṭhakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.51-60 ✗

gotta 1

Meaning family clan; ancestry; lineage; descent; lit. cow pen
Construction go + tta

Examples

na jaṭāhi na gottena,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
yamhi saccañ'ca dhammo ca,
so sucī so ca brāhmaṇo.

DHP 393 brāhmaṇavaggo

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
gotta 2

adj. belonging to a family clan [go] ✗
gottatthaddha

adj. proud of one’s family clan; arrogant about one's ancestry [gotta + thaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning proud of one’s family clan; arrogant about one's ancestry
Construction gotta + thaddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gottena + thaddha)
Commentary (SNPa) jātitthaddho nāma yo, ahaṃ jātisampanno'ti mānaṃ janetvā tena thaddho vātapūritabhastā viya uddhumāto hutvā na kassaci onamati. esa nayo dhanagottatthaddhesu.
Sanskrit gotra + stabdha

Example

jātitthaddho dhanatthaddho,
gottatthaddho ca yo naro,
saññātiṃ atimaññeti,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
gottapaṭisarī

adj. referring to, relying on lineage ✗
gottapaṭisārī

adj. who place value on ancestry; who value family lineage; lit. resorting to clan [gotta + paṭisārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who place value on ancestry; who value family lineage; lit. resorting to clan
Construction gotta + paṭisārī
Commentary (MNa) ye gottapaṭisārino'ti ye janetasmiṃ gottaṃ paṭisaranti, ahaṃ gotamo, ahaṃ kassapo'ti, tesu loke gottapaṭisārīsu khattiyo seṭṭho.
Sanskrit gotra + pratisārin

Example

khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ,
ye gottapaṭisārino,
vijjācaraṇasampanno,
so seṭṭho devamānuse'ti.

Meaning family clan as a pretext
Construction gotta + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (gotta + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) gottaleso nāma vāsiṭṭho diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ vāsiṭṭhaṃ passitvā codeti, vāsiṭṭho mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit gotra + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāno

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

tatr'assa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhato lohitak'ūpadhāno

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
gonakatthata

adj. spread with fleece; (comm) spread with long-haired black cover [gonaka + atthata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning spread with fleece; (comm) spread with long-haired black cover
Construction gonaka + atthata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gonakena + atthata)
Variant goṇakatthata
Commentary (ANa) gonakatthato'ti caturaṅgul'ādhikalomena kāḷakojavena atthato.
Sanskrit goṇikā + āstīrṇa

Examples

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'c'āpi so pallaṅke seti gonak'atthate paṭalik'atthate kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇe sauttaracchade ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāne, atha kho so dukkhaññ'eva seti kodh'ābhibhūto.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tatr'assa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhato lohitak'ūpadhāno

masc. viper ✗
gonisādikā

adj. sited informally in an unfenced settlement(?) (as cows settle? or like encampments of cowherds (nomads) ? or among the cattle ?) ✗
gonisādiniviṭṭha

adj. disorganised; unplanned; unsystematic; lit. settled like sitting cows [go + nisādī + niviṭṭha] ✓

Commentary (VINa) gonisādiniviṭṭho nāma vīthisannives'ādivasena anivisitvā yathā gāvo tattha tattha dve tayo nisīdanti, evaṃ tattha tattha dve tīṇi gharāni katvā niviṭṭho.
Sanskrit go + niṣad + niviṣṭa

Example

gāmo nāma ekakuṭiko'pi gāmo, dvikuṭiko'pi gāmo, tikuṭiko'pi gāmo, catukuṭiko'pi gāmo, samanusso'pi gāmo, amanusso'pi gāmo, parikkhitto'pi gāmo, aparikkhitto'pi gāmo, gonisādiniviṭṭho'pi gāmo, yo'pi sattho atirekacatumāsaniviṭṭho so'pi vuccati gāmo.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
gopa

masc. cowherd; herdsman; cattle guard [√gup + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cowherd; herdsman; cattle guard
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 a (guard)
Construction √gup > gop + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNPa) gunnaṃ pālanato gopo. yo hi attano gāvo pāleti, so gopo'ti vuccati. yo paresaṃ vetanena bhaṭo hutvā, so gopālako.
Notes or go + pa
Sanskrit gopa
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

adj. as deep as a cow hoof; a cow hoof in height; lit. cow foot measure [gopada + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning as deep as a cow hoof; a cow hoof in height; lit. cow foot measure

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante tattha tattha gopadesu udakāni ṭhitāni honti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tattha tattha gopadamattāni mahāsamudde udakāni ṭhitāni honti. pañcamassa, bhikkhave, sūriyassa pātubhāvā aṅgulipabbamattam'pi mahāsamudde udakaṃ na hoti.

AN 7.66 sattasūriyasuttaṃ

Construction gopana + attha + āya
gopanattha + āya
gopanā

fem. protecting; caring for; watching over [√gup] ✗
gopayanta

prp. (+acc) guarding; watching; protecting [√gup + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gopayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning guarding; watching; protecting
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 *aya (guard)
Base √gup + *aya > gopaya (caus)
Construction gopaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ārakkhanta, pālayanta, rakkhanta
Sanskrit gopayat
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

tassa evaṃ ārakkhato gopayato te bhoge rājāno vā haranti, corā vā haranti, aggi vā dahati, udakaṃ vā vahati, appiyā vā dāy'ādā haranti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, yam'pi me ahosi tam'pi no n'atthī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
gopariṇāyaka

masc. leader of the cattle; leader of the herd [go + pariṇāyaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning leader of the cattle; leader of the herd
Construction go + pariṇāyaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gunnaṃ + pariṇāyaka)
Commentary (ANa) gāvo pariṇāyanti yathāruciṃ gahetvā gacchantī'ti gopariṇāyakā.
Sanskrit go + pariṇāyaka

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, gopālako ... na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ

so paṭhamaṃ patāresi ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā. te tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamaṃsu. ath'āpare patāresi balavagāvo dammagāvo.

gopāṇasī

Meaning beam; rafter; wooden framework of a thatch roof

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma jarasālāya gopāṇasiyo oluggaviluggā bhavanti, evam'ev'assu me phāsuḷiyo oluggaviluggā bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

so paṭhamaṃ patāresi ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā. te tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamaṃsu. ath'āpare patāresi balavagāvo dammagāvo.

gopiya

ger. guarding, protecting, watching [√gup] ✗
gopī

fem. woman herding the cows or the wife of a cowherd [√gup] ✗
gopītakaṃ

ind. sipping like a cow; drinking like a cow [go + pīta + ka + aṃ] ✓

Meaning sipping like a cow; drinking like a cow

gopītaka + aṃ

Sanskrit go + pīta +

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṃ pivitvā pakkameyyan'ti. so catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṃ pivitvā pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
gopura

nt. gateway, gate tower ✗
gopetabba

ptp. should be guarded, should be protected, should be watched [√gup] ✗
gopetar

masc. protector [√gup] ✗
gopeti

pr. (+acc) guards; watches; protects [√gup + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of √gup, trans (+acc)
Meaning guards; watches; protects
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 *e (guard)
Base √gup + *e > gope (caus)
Construction gope + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym anurakkhati, ārakkhati, pāleti, rakkhati, sārakkhati
Sanskrit gopayati
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

nagaraṃ yathā paccantaṃ,
guttaṃ santarabāhiraṃ,
evaṃ gopetha attānaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

DHP 315 nirayavaggo
gopetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to guard; to watch; to protect [√gup + *e + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of gopeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to guard; to watch; to protect
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 *e (guard)
Base √gup + *e > gope (caus)
Construction gope + tuṃ
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym rakkhituṃ
Sanskrit gopayitum
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)
gopetvā

abs. having guarded, having protected, having watched [√gup] ✗
gopenta

prp. guarding, protecting, watching [√gup] ✗
gopesi

aor. guarded, protected, watched [√gup] ✗
goppha

masc. ankle ✗
gopphaka

nt. ankle [goppha + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from goppha
Meaning ankle
Construction goppha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym pādagaṇṭhi
Sanskrit gulpha +

Examples

so n'ātidūre pādaṃ uddharati, n'āccāsanne pādaṃ nikkhipati, so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca adduvena adduvaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati, na ca gopphakena gopphakaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena khandh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena hanuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena dant'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena sīsakaṭāhaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
gopphakaṭṭhika

nt. ankle bone [gopphaka + aṭṭhika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ankle bone
Construction gopphaka + aṭṭhika
Compound kammadhāraya (gopphaka + aṭṭhika)
Sanskrit gulpha + asthika

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni apagatasambandhāni disā vidisā vikkhittāni, aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena khandh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena hanuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena dant'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena sīsakaṭāhaṃ.

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
gopphakatta

nt. fact of having ankles [goppha + ka + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from gopphaka
Meaning fact of having ankles
Construction goppha + ka + tta
gopphaka + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit gulpha +
gopphakamatta

adj. ankle-height; ankle deep [gopphaka + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ankle-height; ankle deep
Construction gopphaka + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (gopphaka + matta)
Sanskrit gulpha + mātra

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde aḍḍhaporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, kaṭimattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, jāṇukamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, gopphakamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
gophala

nt. type of (medicinal) fruit ✗
gobhatta

nt. fodder; cattle feed; lit. cow food [go + bhatta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fodder; cattle feed; lit. cow food
Construction go + bhatta
Commentary (SNa) gobhattampī'ti dhaññaphalassa abhāvena lāyitvā kalāpakalāpaṃ bandhitvā ṭhapitaṃ gimhakāle gunnam'pi khādanaṃ bhavissatī'ti attho.
gobhūta

adj. born as a cow; lit. become cow [go + bhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born as a cow; lit. become cow
Construction go + bhūta
gomagga

masc. cowpath; cow-track [go + magga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cowpath; cow-track
Construction go + magga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gunnaṃ + magga)
Commentary (ANa) gomagge'ti gunnaṃ gamanamagge.
Sanskrit go + mārga

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati gomagge siṃsapāvane paṇṇasanthare.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
gomaṇḍala

nt. herd of cattle; lit. circle of cows [go + maṇḍala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning herd of cattle; lit. circle of cows
Construction go + maṇḍala
Synonym gogaṇa
gomaṇḍalaparibbūḷha

adj. surrounded by a herds of cows ✗
gomant

adj. with many cattle; lit. having cattle quality [go + mant] ✓

Grammar adj, from go
Meaning with many cattle; lit. having cattle quality
Construction go + mant
Derivative taddhita (mant)
Commentary (SNa) gohi tath'evā'ti yathā puttimā puttehi, tathā gosāmiko'pi sampannaṃ gomaṇḍalaṃ disvā gāvo nissāya gorasasampattiṃ anubhavamāno gohi nandati.
Sanskrit gomat

Examples

nandati puttehi puttimā,
gomā gohi tath'eva nandati,
upadhīhi narassa nandanā,
na hi so nandati yo nirūpadhī'ti.

SN 1.12 nandatisuttaṃ

socati puttehi puttimā,
gomā gohi tath'eva socati,
upadhīhi narassa socanā,
na hi so socati yo nirūpadhī'ti.

SN 1.12 nandatisuttaṃ
gomaya

nt. cowdung; cowpat; lit. made of cow [go + maya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cowdung; cowpat; lit. made of cow
Construction go + maya
Commentary (ANa) gomayan'ti gomuttaṃ vā ajalaṇḍikā vā.
Sanskrit gomaya

Examples

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

so tattha allāni c'eva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, udakavātañ'ca dadeyya, paṃsukena ca okireyya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
gomayagandha

masc. smell of cowdung; odour of cowpat [gomaya + gandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning smell of cowdung; odour of cowpat
Construction gomaya + gandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gomayassa + gandha)
Sanskrit gomaya + gandha

Example

kiñ'c'āpi taṃ hoti vatthaṃ parisuddhaṃ pariyodātaṃ, atha khv'assa hoti yeva anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato. tam'enaṃ rajako sāmikānaṃ deti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
gomayaggi

masc. cowdung fire [gomaya + aggi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cowdung fire
Construction gomaya + aggi
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (gomayato + aggi)
Sanskrit gomaya + agni

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yaṃ yadeva paccayaṃ paṭicca aggi jalati tena ten'eva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati ... tiṇañ'ca paṭicca aggi jalati, tiṇ'aggitv'eva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati, gomayañ'ca paṭicca aggi jalati, gomay'aggitv'eva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
gomayapiṇḍa

masc. lump of cowdung; ball of cowpat [gomaya + piṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lump of cowdung; ball of cowpat
Construction gomaya + piṇḍa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gomayassa + piṇḍa)
Commentary (SNa) parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍan'ti appamattakaṃ madhukapupphappamāṇaṃ gomayakhaṇḍaṃ. kuto pan'ānen'etaṃ laddhan'ti. paribhaṇḍakaraṇ'atthāya ābhatato gahitan'ti eke. atthassa pana viññāpan'atthaṃ iddhiyā abhisaṅkharitvā hatth'āruḷhaṃ katan'ti veditabban'ti.
Sanskrit gomaya + piṇḍa

Example

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca, ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
gomayapiṇḍasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.96 (SN22.96) ✗
gomayabhakkha

adj. feeding on cowdung [gomaya + bhakkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning feeding on cowdung
Construction gomaya + bhakkha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gomayaṃ + bhakkha)
Sanskrit gomaya + bhakṣa

Examples

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

gorakkha

masc. cow herding; cattle farming; lit. cow protecting [go + rakkha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cow herding; cattle farming; lit. cow protecting
Construction go + rakkha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gāvo + rakkha)

Sanskrit gorakṣā

Example

idha, bhikkhave, kulaputto yena sippaṭṭhānena jīvikaṃ kappeti, yadi muddāya yadi gaṇanāya yadi saṅkhānena yadi kasiyā yadi vaṇijjāya yadi gorakkhena yadi issatthena yadi rājaporisena yadi sipp'aññatarena.

gorakkhā

yathā, mahārāja, mahiyā rājaputtānaṃ hatthi-assa-ratha-dhanu-tharu-lekha-muddā-sikkhā-khagga-manta-suti-sammuti-yuddha-yujjhāpana-kiriyā karaṇīyā, avasesānaṃ puthu-vessa-suddānaṃ kasi vaṇijjā gorakkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
goravaka

masc. mooing; lowing; lit. cow sound [go + ravaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mooing; lowing; lit. cow sound
Construction go + ravaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāvassa + ravaka)
Commentary (MNa) mātugoravakena vuyhamāno'ti mātā purato purato huṃhun'ti goravaṃ katvā saññaṃ dadamānā urena udakaṃ chindamānā gacchati, vacchako tāya goravasaññāya dhenuyā vā urena chinn'odakena gacchamāno mātugoravakena vuyhamāno'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit go + rava +

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, vacchako taruṇako tāva'd'eva jātako mātugoravakena vuyhamāno, so'pi tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamāsi.

govajjha

masc. cow for the slaughter; lit. cow to be killed [go + vajjha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cow for the slaughter; lit. cow to be killed
Construction go + vajjha
Compound kammadhāraya (go + vajjha)
Variant gāvīvajjha
Commentary (NIDD1a) ekam'eko'va maccānaṃ, govajjho viya niyyatī'ti sattānaṃ ekam'eko vadhāya niyyamānagoṇo viya maraṇāya niyyati pāpuṇīyati.
Sanskrit go + vadhya

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, gāvī vajjhā āghātanaṃ nīyamānā yaṃ yadeva pādaṃ uddharati, santikeva hoti vadhassa santikeva maraṇassa, evamevaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, govajjh'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇan'ti.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ
govajjhūpama

adj. like a cow for the slaughter; lit. like a cow to be killed [govajjha + upama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a cow for the slaughter; lit. like a cow to be killed
Construction govajjha + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (govajjha + upama)
Variant gāvīvajjhūpama
Sanskrit go + vadhya + upamā

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, gāvī vajjhā āghātanaṃ nīyamānā yaṃ yadeva pādaṃ uddharati, santik'eva hoti vadhassa santik'eva maraṇassa, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, govajjh'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇan'ti.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ
govata

nt. ascetic practice of behaving like a cow [go + vata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ascetic practice of behaving like a cow
Construction go + vata
Compound kammadhāraya (go + vata)
Sanskrit govrata

Example

tatiyam'pi kho acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ, bhante, puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko. tassa taṃ govataṃ dīgharattaṃ samattaṃ samādinnaṃ. tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo'ti?

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
govatika

adj. performing the ascetic practice of behaving like a cow [go + vatika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning performing the ascetic practice of behaving like a cow
Construction go + vatika
Compound kammadhāraya (go + vatika)
Commentary (MNa) govatiko'ti samādinnagovato, sīse siṅgāni ṭhapetvā naṅguṭṭhaṃ bandhitvā gāvīhi saddhiṃ tiṇāni khādanto viya carati.
Sanskrit govrata +

Example

atha kho puṇṇo ca koliyaputto govatiko acelo ca seniyo kukkuravatiko yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ
gosamita

adj. like cattle; equal to cows [go + samita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like cattle; equal to cows
Construction go + samita
Compound kammadhāraya (go + samita)
Commentary (SNa) gosamitaṃ dhanan'ti gohi samaṃ godhanasamaṃ godhanasadisaṃ aññaṃ dhanaṃ nāma n'atthi bhagavā'ti āha.
Sanskrit go + samita

Example

n'atthi puttasamaṃ pemaṃ,
n'atthi gosamitaṃ dhanaṃ,
n'atthi sūriyasamā ābhā,
samuddaparamā sarā'ti.

SN 1.13 natthiputtasamasuttaṃ
gosāmika

Meaning family name of a ascetic teacher; Makkhali Gosāla; lit. from a cow shed

Examples

atha kho sahali devaputto makkhaliṃ gosālaṃ ārabbha bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho makkhali gosālo saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
gosālattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 23 (TH23) ✗
gosiṅga

masc. cow horn [go + siṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cow horn
Construction go + siṅga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāvassa + siṅga)
Sanskrit gośṛṅga

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
gosiṅgasālavana

nt. name of a monastery; lit. cow horn sal tree forest [gosiṅga + sālavana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a monastery; lit. cow horn sal tree forest
Construction gosiṅga + sālavana
Compound kammadhāraya (gosiṅga + sālavana)
Commentary (MNa) gosiṅgasālavanadāye'ti tattha ekassa jeṭṭhakarukkhassa khandhato gosiṅgasaṇṭhānaṃ hutvā viṭapaṃ uṭṭhahi, taṃ rukkhaṃ upādāya sabbam'pi taṃ vanaṃ gosiṅgasālavanan'ti saṅkhaṃ gataṃ.
Sanskrit gośṛṅga + śāla + vana

Example

ramaṇīyaṃ, āvuso ānanda, gosiṅgasālavanaṃ, dosinā ratti, sabbaphāliphullā sālā, dibbā, maññe, gandhā sampavanti, kathaṃrūpena, āvuso ānanda, bhikkhunā gosiṅgasālavanaṃ sobheyyā'ti?

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
gosiṅgasālavanadāya

masc. name of a monastery; lit. cow-horn sal tree forest monastery [gosiṅga + sālavana + dāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monastery; lit. cow-horn sal tree forest monastery
Construction gosiṅga + sālavana + dāya
Compound kammadhāraya (gosiṅgasālavana + dāya)
Commentary (MNa) gosiṅgasālavanadāye'ti tattha ekassa jeṭṭhakarukkhassa khandhato gosiṅgasaṇṭhānaṃ hutvā viṭapaṃ uṭṭhahi, taṃ rukkhaṃ upādāya sabbam'pi taṃ vanaṃ gosiṅgasālavanan'ti saṅkhaṃ gataṃ. dāyo'ti avisesena araññass'etaṃ nāmaṃ. tasmā gosiṅgasālavanadāye'ti gosiṅgasālavan'āraññe'ti attho.
Sanskrit gośṛṅga + śāla + vana + dāva

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
gosīla

nt. conduct of a cow; cow's behaviour [go + sīla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning conduct of a cow; cow's behaviour
Construction go + sīla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāvassa + sīla)
Sanskrit go + śīla

Example

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
gosīsa

masc. yellow sandal-wood ✗
gosīsaka

nt. type of fragrant sandalwood ✗
gosīsakādisāracandana

nt. gosīsaka, etc. sandalwood ✗
gohata

adj. churned into sharp clods by cattle ✗
gohanuka

masc. cow's jaw bone ✗
goḷa

masc. ball [√guḷ + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from guḷa
Meaning ball
Root Family √guḷ
Root √guḷ×1 a (roll around, protect)
Construction √guḷ > goḷ + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit gola
Sanskrit Root √guḍ 6 (guard)
goḷaka

masc. small ball [√guḷ + *a + ka] ~

Grammar masc, dimin of goḷa
Meaning small ball
Root Family √guḷ
Root √guḷ×1 a (roll around, protect)
Construction √guḷ > goḷ + *a + ka
goḷa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit golaka
Sanskrit Root √guḍ 6 (guard)
gvākappa

masc. bodily behaviour of a cow; cow's physical manner [go + ākappa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bodily behaviour of a cow; cow's physical manner
Construction go > gv + ākappa
Phonetic Change o > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Variant gavākappa
